loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene O. is 50 and married with three children. She owns a poultry farm, where she raises and sells birds. She has been in LAPO for four years. She needs the loan of $700 to buy more poultry birds for sale. She studied the trade for six months and started her business in 1982.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds for sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I. is 70 years old and married with 9 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more goats for sale. She has been in business since1987.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale

loans.name: Mikumi A Group

texts.en:
Grace, age 38, is married with 5 children (ages 22, 17, 15, 15, and 11). She owns a kiosk which she began 6 years ago. Her business is open from 7am to 10pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of about $36.

In the past, Grace took out 2 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her kiosk business. She now hopes for a new loan to increase the same business and to open a food stand. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling various foods and clothes, working at kiosks, and tailoring.

In the picture, Grace is second from the right.

loans.use: To increase her business

payments.comment: This business was accidently posted with a loan term of 16 months instead of 16 weeks. Tujijenge is apologizing for this mistake. The loan term has now been completed as of this month and Mikumi A group has repaid the loan successfully

loans.name: Tupokigwe

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Tupokigwe M.. She is married with five children, aged 6, 9, 14, 17, and 21. In 2000 Tupokigwe established a farming and timber business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Tupokigwe

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Tupokigwe M.. She is married with five children, aged 6, 9, 14, 17, and 21. In 2000 Tupokigwe established a farming and timber business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Phurola

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Phurola L.. She is married with five children aged 3, 10, 13, 15, and 20 years, and has two other dependents who are her nieces. In 2002 Phurola established a traveling sales business and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock.

The image of an African woman carrying a load on her head has become a somewhat stereotypical symbol of the burdens borne by women in Africa. But it truly does represent the strength and resilience of our sisters on the hot continent, whose determination to create opportunities where there are none, and to provide for themselves and their families, is inspiring.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support; hence, poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Emmaus

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Emmaus K.. She is married with three children. In 2005 Emmaus established a grocery business and, in 2006, a hair salon. Emmaus has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a loan of $525 in order to purchase an additional stock of hair care products and wigs in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support; hence. poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair care products and wigs in bulk.

loans.name: Mamntambo

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 49 year-old Mamntambo M.. She is married with two children, ages 12 and 15, and has one other dependent, who is her nephew. In 2003 Mamntambo established a maize business. Mamntambo has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam produces chocolate which she sells in small cardboard packages in the city of La Paz and around the country.

Her home and workshop are located in the San Sebastian neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan. The credit will be used to buy the main supplies for her work as cocoa, sugar, essences, vitamins, cardboard packages and bags.

Her work allows her to request this loan because she has experience in her business and the analysis of its cash flow shows she will have the capacity to repay the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Description Historia del Cliente: Miriam elabora chocolate en paquetes de cartón en la ciudad de La Paz y el interior del País.

Su domicilio y Taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona San Sebastián de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para capital de trabajo (Cacao, azúcar, esencias, vitaminas, bolsas y cartón). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su actividad económica y el análisis de flujo de caja muestra la capacidad de repago del crédito.

loans.use: The credit will be used to buy the main supplies for her business as cocoa, sugar, essences, vitamins, cardboard packages and bags

payments.comment: Early pay off. Miriam is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria is a widow who sells candy and groceries at her small stand. She has four children, one of whom is under her care. She lives in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz. This is her fourth loan from IMPRO. The loan will be used to cover the medical treatment her son is receiving due to an accident he experienced. Her job allows her to request this loan because of her experience as an entrepreneur, and of her impeccable credit history with our microfinance institution. Furthermore, her business generates enough income to both repay her loans and cover her living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Hilaria es viuda y tiene un puesto donde vende dulces y abarrotes; tiene cuatro hijos y uno esta a su cargo. Vive en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para el tratamiento medico de su hijo ya que sufrió un accidente. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como comerciante y su historial de pagos con nosotros es impecable, además de que su actividad económica produce ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Cover medical expenses for son who was in an accident

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Zaituni M.. She is single with three children, aged 1 and 13, and has one other dependent, who is her nephew. In 2006 Zaituni established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA. SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
History of the client: Virginia is a traveling merchant. She sells perfumes, cosmetics, and decorations in large quantities. She travels to Santa Cruz (one of the largest departments in the country) every two weeks to carry out her work. This is the fifth time that she is requesting a credit with IMPRO. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a "1" client, which means that she has fulfilled her payment obligations very well. The requested amount will go towards the purchase of merchandise (barrettes, decorations, cosmetics, and perfumes).

Her previous loans and work allow her to request this loan, since she has good experience in her business which will let her earn income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: Virginia es comerciante viajera, vende perfumes cosméticos y adornos en cantidad, viaja a Santa Cruz (uno de los departamentos más grandes del país) quincenalmente para efectuar su actividad económica. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (trabas, adornos, cosméticos y perfumes).

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like barrettes, cosmetics, and decorations for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Client history: Rosa works in a printing shop where she binds books. She is separated from her husband and has one child that she takes care of. Her house is located in the area of Alto Villa San Antonio in the Forno sector of La Paz

It is the first time that she is soliciting credit. The amount she is asking for is for her to be able to take out two special lease agreements used in Bolivia and with that be able to better their quality of life. Her work history allows her to obtain this credit since she has been an employed for more than 10 years. A financial analysis shows that her income is sufficient to cover the loan.

Traslated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

Historia del Cliente: la señora Rosa trabaja en una imprenta donde realiza el compaginado de libros, está separada de su esposo y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto Villa San Antonio Sector Forno de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para que pueda tomar dos piezas en calidad de Anticretico y así poder mejorar su calidad de Vida. Sus antecedentes de trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que es una empleada con una antigüedad de más de 10 años. El análisis financiero muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Take out leases for two living quarters to improve the comfort of her daughter and herself.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta produces decorative articles which she sells during the local fairs and her husband is a bus driver for the “16 of July minibuses union”. Their home is located in the Alto San Pedro’s neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the 4th time Benedicta has requested a loan. The credit will be used to buy ribbons, cloth, fringes, sequins and other articles that she needs to create her decorative articles for the local fairs.

She has a lot of experience in her business and her husband, who has a daily income, helps her with the family’s revenue. That is why she has the possibility to cover her personal needs as well as the repayment for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Benedicta elabora adornos para las ferias y su esposo es chofer del sindicato 16 de julio de minibuses.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de cintas, tela, flecos, lentejuelas y otros artículos que le servirán para la preparación de su mercadería para las ferias departamentales.

Tiene experiencia en su negocio y además que su esposo le ayuda con los ingresos familiares ya que su trabajo de chofer le da ingresos diariamente, por lo que tiene las posibilidades de cubrir sus requerimientos personales así como el repago del crédito solicitado.

loans.use: To buy materials to produce decorative articles which she sells during the local fairs

loans.name: Baraka B Group

texts.en:
Zelda, age 32, is married with 3 children (ages 16, 14, and 3). She owns a chicken business which she began 4 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 4pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of around $109.

In the past, Zelda took 3 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She hopes for a new loan to increase the same business. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in selling various foods, shoes, chicken, charcoal, and sarongs.

In the picture, Zelda is second from left.

loans.use: To increase business

payments.comment: The loan term was listed incorrectly. At this point, the loan has been repaid in full. Tujijenge apologizes for this mistake.

loans.name: Limber

texts.es:
Don Limber owns a stall where he sells garments and requires a loan to make his business bloom as he has been short of working capital for the past months and therefore he needs financial support as the income from his business covers his university studies. It is the fourth time he is requesting a loan. He is marked by this institution as a number 1 client as he has always repaid regularly his previous loans. The amount requested will be used to buy merchandise (overalls, t-shirts, turtle necks, etc.). His credit and work record makes it possible for him to request this loan as he has experience in his line of business and thus will earn enough to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: El señor Limber tiene un puesto donde vende ropa y requiere el crédito para reactivar su negocio ya que los últimos meses le falto capital de trabajo por lo que será de gran ayuda este financiamiento pues que con los ingresos de su negocio cubre sus estudios universitarios. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (Buzos, Poleras y otros) Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of overalls, t-shirts, turtle necks and other garments to increase clothing sales.

loans.name: Domitila Del Carmen

texts.es:
The sale of food is a very competitive business because of the fact that many people dedicate themselves to this activity and the client’s decision is based in all moments on buying from whoever prepares the best food. Because of these motives, Ms. Domitila Levya is an excellent cook and dedicates herself to the business of selling food in the Mayoreo de Managua market. 12 years ago she began this activity in the outskirts of the market without having her own store, however as the months passed and the necessity of caring for her two small children grew, she looked for a way to solicit for her own place in the market and it was granted adequately. Today thanks to the support that Ceprodel offered her for half the loans, she has been able to amplify her business in the purchase of materials such as plates utensils and place settings. Her necessity these days is to invest in the infrastructure because her store is small and therefore doesn’t present good conditions for the patrons.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy competitivo por el hecho de que son muchas las personas que se dedican a esta actividad y la decisión del cliente se basa en todo momento en comprar a quien prepare mejor los alimentos. Por este motivo la señora Domitila L. es una excelente cocinera y se dedica al negocio de venta comida en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua.

Desde hace 12 años inició esta actividad en las afueras del mercado sin tener un local propio, sin embargo a medida que pasaron los meses y por la necesidad de mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos, buscó la manera de solicitar un local propio en el mercado siéndole otorgado satisfactoriamente.

Hoy en día gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los préstamos, ha logrado ampliar su negocio en la compra de materiales como platos, pailas y cubiertos. Su necesidad actualmente es invertir en infraestructura ya que su local es pequeño y además no presenta buenas condiciones para los clientes.

loans.use: The sale of food.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca owns a store where she sells soft drinks, groceries, candy, bread, and other products suitable to sell at a local store. Her home and store is located in the zone of Obispo Indaburo, City of La Paz.

It is the sixth time she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and the second time from KIVA. She has repaid all previous loans regularly. The amount requested will be used to buy merchandise in order to meet expectations from her customers.

She is recommendable for this loan as she has experience in selling her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Francisca tiene una tienda donde vende refrescos, abarrotes, dulces pan y otros productos ofertables en una tienda de barrio. Su domicilio y tienda se encuentran ubicados en la zona Obispo Indaburo de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez que solicita la ayuda de KIVA. Las cancelaciones del crédito anterior las realizó en forma regular. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería y así surtir de sus productos para las necesidades de su clientela.

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en la venta de mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of merchandise for a local store.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Mrs. Dorcas I. sells foodstuffs and provisions at her store. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She is from Edo State. She needs the loan of $375 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sale. She has been in business since 1990.

loans.use: To buy more food and provisions for sale

loans.name: Sara Lourdes

texts.es:
Sara Lourdes C. is a woman who has dedicated herself to the sale of food in the Mayoreo de Managua market for the last 13 long years. Since she was young, she has stood out as a person who is hard-working with a great spirit for succeeding in her business. Being a single mother and with three children whom she has to care for, she has continued with much strength, on account of the fact that she is single, she has played the role of father and mother for her three loved children. A problem that Ms. Sara Lourdes has had to overcome is that her business was not established in her own store in the market, but could be found in the outskirts, because of that she decided to turn to Ceprodel so that they could provide financial support to invest in the purchase and construction of her own store which is her greatest dream in this moment. (These days with Ceprodel she carries 5 credits.)

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara Lourdes C. es una dama que se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua desde hace 13 largos años. Desde muy pequeña, se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio. Siendo madre soltera y con tres hijos a los que tiene que mantener ha logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo, a pesar de que es soltera, ha jugado el papel de padre y madre para sus tres amados hijos.

Una problemática que atraviesa la señora Sara Lourdes es que su negocio aun no ha sido establecido en un local propio en el mercado, sino que se encuentra en las afueras, por lo que decidió recurrir a Ceprodel para que le brinde apoyo crediticio para invertir en la adquisición y construcción de un propio local que es su mayor sueño en este momento. (Actualmente con Ceprodel lleva 5 créditos)

loans.use: The purchase of food

loans.name: Emelina De Los Santo

texts.es:
Nicaragua is known as a country with many working women, and among them we find Señora Emelina Martinez, who has dedicated herself to the sale of food and drinks for 7 years in the Mayoreo market in the capital. She began her business with an investment of C$6000 (six thousand cordobas), with which she obtained, with the support of her husband, the equipment she needed for this work. Later, as the years passed, sadly she separated from her husband and became primarily responsible for the care of two small children who today she struggles to provide with shelter, education and nutrition. As she is aware of the need to care for her little ones, Señora Emelina has acquired loans from Ceprodel, with which she has purchased raw materials to produce food and therefore to obtain greater income to care for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva translator

Nicaragua se caracteriza por ser un país lleno de mujeres muy trabajadoras, entre ellas encontramos a la señora Emelina M. quien desde hace 7 años se ha dedicado a la venta de comida y refrescos en el mercado Mayoreo de la capital. Comenzó su negocio con una inversión de C$ 6000 (Seis mil córdobas) que los obtuvo por medio del apoyo de su esposo para comprar los enseres utilizados en la actividad, luego por medio de que pasaron los años lamentablemente fue separada de su esposo y le quedo la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos quien hoy lucha por brindarles abrigo, educación y alimentación. Al estar consiente de que necesita mantener a sus pequeños, la señora Emelina ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel el cual le han beneficiado en la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos y por ende obtener mas utilidades para darle la cobertura a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi M. is a single mother with two dependent children. Twenty eight years ago she began selling fruits and vegetables in the wholesale market, distinguishing herself principally as a source of bananas.

She is a very hardworking woman. She is well known locally as one of the founders of the wholesale market where she works. She is very proud to be working in the market she helped launch.

Deysi has been persevering to improve her economic situation and provide an education to her two children for a long time. Unfortunately her children are not currently in school, primarily as a result of the family's difficult economic situation, and also because they support their mother in the daily work at the market. However, in spite of the family's current situation, Deysi dreams that her children will complete their educations. For that very reason she has started to apply for loans from Ceprodel in order to invest in the business and earn the income with which to cover her children's school expenses. She has previously received and repaid three loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Deysi M. es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo. Desde hace 28 años inició a vender verduras y frutas en el mercado Mayoreo, destacándose principalmente en la venta de plátanos en el sector.

Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que es una de las fundadoras del mercado Mayoreo donde labora, esto la ha llevado a que sea muy reconocida en el local y por tal razón se siente orgullosa de laborar en este negocio.

Por mucho tiempo atrás ha venido luchando por mejorar su situación económica y brindarles educación a sus dos pequeños ya que lamentablemente ellos no estudian primeramente por su difícil situación económica y segundo porque apoyan a su madre en el trabajo diario en el mercado. Sin embargo, a pesar de esta situación, la señora Deysi anhela que sus hijos estudien y por tal razón ha iniciado a solicitar préstamos en Ceprodel para invertir en el negocio y así obtener mayores utilidades para cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.(Actualmente su record crediticio es de tres créditos)

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en: Tuti, 34, is a mother of two sons. Her husband, D., works as a coolie in a fishing area and earns very little. Tuti has to earn extra income to support her family's needs. She sells instant noodles and beverages at her house, earning US$5 a day. Tuti is a member of MBK and is requesing a loan of US$125 to increase her business capital, so she could pay for her children's education. She promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati, 40, is a mother of seven children. Her husband, D., is a driver and earns very little. To support her family, Yati sells Indonesian Salad 'gado-gado' at her house, earning US$10.5 a day. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$100 to expand her business, so she could pay for her children's education. Yati will repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
Sr. Gustavo Antonio Castellon sells produce like tomatoes, chiltoma peppers and cabbage in the Mayoreo market in Managua. It must be pointed out that at any hour or any moment you will find him at this shop, and he is a very hardworking person. His difficult economic situation has made him search for ways to earn a living, however despite the inconsistencies of life, he has always worked to support his wife of many years, and the to grandchildren he is raising.

Gustavo Castellon has been obtained credit with Ceprodel for the last six months (three loans), and he has taken advantage of this to acquire more produce and at the same time support his wife and provide for his two grandchildren who need him. Sr. Gustavo is the only income earner in his household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Gustavo Antonio C. se dedica a la venta de verduras como tomates, chiltomas y repollos en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua. Es necesario destacar que a toda hora y en todo momento se encuentra en su localidad por lo que es una persona muy trabajadora. Su difícil situación económica lo ha llevado a buscar la manera de ganarse la vida, sin embargo a pesar de las inconsistencias de la vida, siempre ha logrado apoyar a su anciana esposa y sus dos nietos a los que mantiene.

Desde hace seis meses el señor Gustavo C. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (tres créditos) y según cuenta los ha aprovechado para surtir mas sus verduras y además para apoyar a su anciana esposa y mantener a sus dos nietos que tanto lo necesitan. El señor Gustavo es el único ingreso económico en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes and chiltoma peppers

loans.name: Rosidah

texts.en: Rosidah, 40, is a mother of 2 children. Previously, she earned her living selling cakes, but the income was not enough to cover her family's daily expenses. Now Rosidah works as a tailor at her house, earning US$10.5 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$125 to buy more sewing machines. Thereby, she hopes to increase her income even more. Rosidah promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines

loans.name: Rusminah

texts.en: Rusminah is a 40-year-old mother of 5 children. She has a food booth by her house where she sells fresh food, earning US$10.5 a day. As a member of MBK, Rusminah is asking for a loan of US$100 to increase her business capital. She works to help her husband, E., in providing the daily necessities for the family. Rusminah promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Netty

texts.en: Netty, 56, is a mother of 3 grown-up children. Her husband, A., is no longer working, so Netty has to support her family by herself. She produces and sells fresh food at her house, earning US$10.5 a day. Netty needs a loan of US$75 to expand her business. As a member of MBK, she promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Amy Lucia

texts.es:
For 6 years, Sra. Amy M. has worked selling produce like tomatos, garlic, chiltomas (a kind of pepper), oranges, etc. She works daily in the Mayoreo market of Managua, where her sister helps her attend the store. She is a single mother with a daughter who needs her now more than ever as she is about to begin high school.

Since she began her business at the market, her quality of life has improved a bit, since her difficult economic situation had made it hard for her to support the daughter who so needs her. Currently she has completed loans with Ceprodel, which have helped her greatly in acquiring greater quantities of vegetables. Not only this, but she has also been able to support her beloved daughter who needs her. She hopes to continue requesting loans in order to increase her small business and help her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Translator.

Desde hace 6 años, la señora Amy M. se dedica a la venta de verduras como tomates, ajos, chiltomas, naranjas, etc. Su labor la inicia diariamente en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua, donde recibe apoyo de una hermana para atender el negocio. Es madre soltera y con una hija a su cargo el cual hoy mas que nunca necesita su apoyo para ir al colegio porque está próxima a ingresar.

Desde que comenzó su negocio, en el mercado ha mejorado un poco su nivel de vida ya que la dura situación económica que ha atravesado le ha impedido brindarle el apoyo a su pequeña hija que tanto lo necesita. Hoy en día ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel el cual según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente ya que adquiere mayores cantidades de verduras y no sol eso sino que tamben apoya mas a su amada hija que tanto lo necesita. Anhela seguir solicitando los créditos para ampliar su pequeño negocio y darle el apoyo a su hija.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nining

texts.en: Nining A., 39, has four children. Her husband, Bambang, works as a coolie at a workshop, earning very little income. Nining produces and sells fried snack and flavoured ice door-to-door to earn more income for the family. She is asking for a loan of US$100 to increase her business capital, so she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti H.,35, has three children. Her husband, Akah, is no longer working; therefore, to provide income for the family, Siti opened a small shop at her house where she sells food, earning US$15 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$100 to buy more goods for her shop. Siti will repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Nhuận, 46 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children at Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. The youngest one is still in school. In addition to farming a half acre rice paddy, she also weaves straw mattresses for extra income. She needs money to buy more straw because the in house supply is not enough for the production. At first she took out small loans, 50-100USD, gradually she applies for larger amount. Income from straw mattress production becomes central to her family’s economy. Her husband and children support her always. Tết is around the corner, she is applied for a loan of 325USD to buy more straw. Presently, her income is 100USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Nhuận, 46 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Con út của chị còn đang đi học nên ngoài làm 7 sào ruộng, chị Nhuận còn dệt chiếu để tạo thu nhập. Nguồn nguyên liệu từ gia đình không đủ chị phải mua lác từ bên ngoài. Thời gian đầu chị chỉ dám vay từ 50-100USD để mua lác. Sau khi đã quen với cách hoàn trả tuần, chị đã mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn cao hơn. Nguồn thu từ dệt chiếu đã trở thành nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình. Chồng và các con chị Nhuận đều tích cực hỗ trợ chị trong thời gian rỗi. Gần đến Tết, chị dự định xin vay 325USD để mua thêm lác tăng thu nhập. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Nhuận là 100USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy straw for straw mattress production

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti A. is a 38-year-old widow who has two children. To provide day-to-day necessities for her family, she sells clothes, sheets, blankets, etc. on credit door-to-door, earning US$16 a day. As a member of MBK, Siti is asking for a loan of US$125 to expand her business in order to be able to pay for her children's education. She will repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Lơ, 38 years of age, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. She has 3 children, two of them are still in school. As most people in her village, beside farming, her main activity is weaving straw mattresses. She borrows money from the Fund to buy straw. Part of money from selling mattresses is for household expenses, the rest is for weekly loan repayments. After 5 years with the Fund and with her industrious nature, she has enough saving for a nice house for her family. Quality straw mattress starts quality raw material. Mrs. Lơ discusses with her husband about taking out a loan of 325USD to buy straw and fertilizer for her in house straw planting.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Lơ, 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2003. Chị có 3 con trong đó 2 cháu còn đang đi học. Như phần lớn người dân trong thôn, ngoài làm ruộng, công việc chủ yếu của chị Lơ là dệt chiếu. Để có nguyên liệu chị đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn về mua lác. Số tiền bán chiếu hàng tuần được để dành ra một phần chi tiêu cho gia đình, một phần dùng trả tiền tuần. Tính cần cù, chịu khó tích lũy giúp chị Lơ có được một ngôi nhà khang trang sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ. Sau một thời gian dài làm chiếu chị Lơ nhận thấy để chiếu dệt có chất lượng phải có nguồn nguyên liệu tốt. Vậy nên chị bàn với chồng và xin vay 325USD để mua lác và phân bón để tự tạo lấy nguồn nguyên liệu sản xuất.

loans.use: Buy sedge and fertilizer

loans.name: Elia

texts.en: Elia is 25 years old and has a child. She sells cosmetics such as soap, hand and body lotion, talc, etc. on credit door-to-door in the nearby villages, earning US$32 a month. Elia is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$100 to buy more cosmetics for sale. She will repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Oranges and mandarins are the products that Mrs. Flor de Maria Velázquez has been enthusiastically selling in the wholesale market in Managua for 20 years. Before selling these products she was a housewife. Recognizing the family's difficulties covering the household expenses she decided to invest the little capital she had in the purchase of oranges and mandarins in order to later market them.

We cannot overlook the usefulness of investing in the infrastructure of her business since she currently has neither walls not roof in her sales stall. She uses small pieces of wood to hold up the piece of plastic that protects her from the sun and rain.

Very wisely, Mrs. V. has used loans from Ceprodel to stock her business with an increased volume of fruit. Her greatest desire is to build her own market stall in order to offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Naranjas y mandarinas son los productos que muy esforzadamente vende la señora Flor de Maria V. en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua desde hace 20 años. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad su labor era desempeñarse como ama de casa, pero al contemplar que difícilmente cubría los gastos de su hogar decide invertir su poco capital en la compra de naranjas y mandarinas para luego comercializarlas.

No podemos pasar por alto que le es de mucha utilidad invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio ya que actualmente no posee techo ni paredes, sino que utiliza algunos trozos de madera que sostienen plásticos para cubrirla del sol y de igual manera de la lluvia.

Muy sabiamente, la señora V. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para surtir su negocio con mayores volúmenes de productos, su mayor anhelo es construir su propio tramo para brindar un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of oranges and mandarins

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Tỵ, 52 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children at Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa province. She’s been a member with the TYM Fund for 4 years. The main family’s income comes from fishing and selling fish activiT.. While she sells fish at the open market all her children go out to sea fishing. She takes out loans from the Fund. Income from selling fish is used for repayments. Sometimes, fishing becomes hard due to weather, her husband’s veteran pay is used. She is discussing with her husband about taking out a loan of 375USD to buy fishing equipment. The family’s monthly income is 125USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Tỵ, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Chị là thành viên tham gia Quỹ năm thứ 4. Thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình hiện nay là từ đánh cá. Công việc của chị Tỵ là bán cá ngoài chợ. 4 người con của chị Tỵ đều đã trưởng thành và là lao động chính trong việc đánh bắt cá. Những khi biển động lượng cá đánh bắt được giảm, nguồn hoàn trả tiền tuần trông vào lương bệnh binh của anh. Đây chính là nguồn đảm bảo cho vốn vay của gia đình. Để việc đánh bắt được thuận lợi chị Tỵ bàn bạc với gia đình và xin vay thêm 375USD để mua phương tiện, đồ nghề đánh cá tăng lượng cá đánh bắt. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 125USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy set of tools to catch fishes

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Sri D., 22, has no children yet. She sells cosmetics on credit, door-to-door in the villages to earn income for her family. Her husband Andri has been unemployed for a long time. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125 to buy additional cosmetics. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy various cosmetics

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị V., 48 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2002. She raises her children and takes care her parents by herself. Due to the hardship she has a worn look than women of same age. Her main income comes from basket weaving and a small animal husbandry business. She also tends a half acre rice paddy. The family’s economy seems better when she takes out loans from the Fund. She upgraded her straw roof hut to a tiled roof house recently. Her income is 80USD a month. She is taking out a loan of 325USD to recondition her cattle pen also to buy a calf with hope that she can sell later for a profit.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị V., 48 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002. Hoàn cảnh gia đình chị rất khó khăn. Một mình chị nuôi con ăn học và bố mẹ già nên trông chị vất vả hơn so với những người cùng tuổi. Nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của chị V. từ đan thúng và chăn nuôi. Ngoài ra chị còn làm thêm 6 sào ruộng. Khi được vay vốn từ Quỹ Tình thương, chị đã biết tính toán làm ăn phát triển đồng vốn kinh tế gia đình có nhiều thay đổi. Từ ngôi nhà nhỏ chị sửa sang nâng cấp lên thành nhà ngói. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng hiện nay của chị V. là 80USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị quyết định vay 325USD để đầu tư sửa chữa chuồng trại và mua thêm con bê. Chị hi vọng sau vài tháng có thể bán được bê với giá cao hơn

loans.use: Repair cattle pen and buy a calf

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lương Thị Hậu, 55 years old, is a fourth year member of the TYM Fund. She lives with her husband and 3 children in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa province. Her main income is from animal husbandry business and farming. She expands her animal stock using loan money from the Fund. At first, the loan was 50USD; now she can take out a loan of 200-300USD. Her family’s economy improves because the effective use of these loans. Her oldest son now a level 3 teacher. The youngest is in high school. She would like to take out a loan of 325USD to buy piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lương Thị Hậu, 55 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Thu nhập chính của chị là từ chăn nuôi và làm ruộng. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ nguồn vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi của chị Hậu được mở rộng thêm nhiều. Từ mức vốn ban đầu 50USD đến nay chị đã vay mức 200-300USD. Những đồng vốn vay được từ Quỹ được chị sử dụng rất hiệu quả. Kinh tế ổn định giúp chị nuôi con ăn học thành đạt. Người con đầu của chị Hậu đang là giáo viên cấp 3, con út hiện đang học phổ thông. Vào thời điểm này, khi nhận thấy giá cả từ cho chăn nuôi đang mang lại lợi nhuận, chị Hậu quyết định vay 325USD để mua lợn con.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Cicih

texts.en: Cicih J., 36, is a mother of 2 children. Her husband, Wawan, is a private driver who earns US$53 a month. In order to earn extra income for the family, Cicih sells candy door-to-door and to shops nearby, earning US$3 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$100 to increase her business capital so she could pay for her children's education. Cicih promises to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Huyền, 34, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2003. She has 3 school age children. Her main occupation is to tend her general store. She’s been doing that for 8 years now. The more she does it the more she becomes efficient of using loan’s fund. Money from the loans from the TYM Fund are used to expand her store. This Tết, she needs fund for buying goods to get ready for the biggest holiday celebration. She discusses with her husband about taking out a loan of 325USD for that. Her income is 150USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Huyền, 34 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. Chị có 3 con còn đang trong tuổi đi học. Nghề nghiệp chính của chị là bán hàng tạp hóa. Chị làm công việc này đã được 8 năm. Nguồn vốn vay từ Quỹ giúp chị tăng lượng hàng bán ra của cửa hàng. Sau nhiều năm chị Huyền rút ra kinh nghiệm: buôn bán phụ thuộc vào việc biết nắm bắt cơ hội, thời điểm thì mới mang lại hiệu quả cao. Vào cuối năm việc buôn bán có nhiều thuận lợi, nên yêu cầu phải có hàng để đáp ứng nhu cầu của người dân. Để phục vụ cho hàng Tết chị đã bàn bạc với chồng vay 325USD để lấy hàng khi giá cả đang còn thấp. Thu nhập hiện nay của chị Huyền là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Salamah

texts.en: Salamah is 42 years old and a mother of one child. Her husband, R., is a coolie at a workshop and earns very little. To provide extra income for the family, Salamah makes cakes upon order at her house, earning US$16 a day. She also makes and sells fried snacks. Salamah needs a loan of US$75 to increase her cake business capital. As a member of MBK, she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị S., 54 years old, lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa province. She is a member of branch 14 of the TYM Fund. Her family’s main activities are fishing related. Her husband goes on weeks long fishing trips and she sells fish at the open market. Beside that she farms and raises a small animal stock. All that effort are for raising her children with the best education available. Her wish now is to continue to taking out loans from the TYM Fund to do business and saving for their future. She discusses with her husband a bout applying for a loan of 375USD to buy fishing net and equipment.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị S., 54 tuổi, sống tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa hiện đang là thành viên của chi nhánh 14 Quỹ Tình thương. Nghề nghiệp chủ yếu của gia đình là từ đánh cá. Thông thường anh đi đánh bắt cá một hai tuần mới về còn chị bán cá ngoài chợ. Ngoài việc bán cá chị S. còn làm thêm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn gà. Hiệu quả kinh tế mang lại giúp chị S. có điều kiện cho các con đi học tới mức cao nhất. 4 người con của hai anh chị đều học hành thành đạt và hiện đã ra trường. Mong ước của chị S. hiện nay là tiếp tục tham gia Quỹ để vay vốn tạo thu nhập tích lũy sau này. Để việc đánh bắt cá hiệu quả, mang lại thu nhập cao chị S. bàn bạc với chồng và xin vay 375USD để sắm lưới và đồ nghề đánh cá mới.

loans.use: Buy fishing net and equipment

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị T., 45 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children in Quảng Xương. She’s been a member of the TYM Fund for 4 years. Her family is in very difficult situation due to her husband’s illness. She runs the household with help from her oldest son. When borrowing money from the Fund she plans carefully. The money would be used exclusively for raising her animal stock. The income from weaving bamboo baskets would be used for repayments. Because of her discipline, she now just built a level 4 house to replace her family’s clay hut. This round of loan, she will take out a loan of 376USD to invest in stud pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị T., 45 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ. Hoàn cảnh gia đình chị rất khó khăn, chồng hay ốm đau, một mình chị lo toan mọi việc gia đình cùng người con trai lớn. Khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã có sự phân chia rõ ràng: vốn vay từ Quỹ dùng chăn nuôi lợn, nguồn hoàn trả hàng tuần lấy từ việc đan thúng. Nhờ tính toán hợp lý mà hiệu quả kinh tế thu được cao, chi T. đã làm được nhà cấp 4 khang trang thay cho gian nhà đất trước đây. Vòng vốn này chị quyết định vay 375USD để đầu tư mua lợn giống về chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Nurasih

texts.en: Nurasih is 27 years old and has a daughter. Her husband, E., is a public transportation 'angkot' driver who earns US$2 a day. To earn extra income for the family, Nurasih opened a booth where she sells food and beverages, and is now earning US$7 a day. The business has been growing very fast since she became a member of MBK. Nurasih is asking for a loan of US$125 to buy more goods for sale. She promises to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi V., 44 years old, is living in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa with her husband and her 5 children. Her family’s main activities are fishing and selling fishes. The two oldest sons together with their father go fishing on the ocean, and Mrs. V. sells fish in the market. During previous years, her family life was difficult because she had to send the children to school and borrowing money was not as easy. Since the TYM Fund comes to her region and it has a proper repaying method, Mrs.V. enthusiastically joins it. The money borrowed is used effectively, and as a result, her family income increases. Her current family income is 180 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 375 USD to buy more tools for fishing.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trình Thị Viết, 44 tuổi, sống tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa cùng chồng và 5 người con. Công việc chủ yếu của gia đình là đánh và bán cá. 2 người con trai lớn theo bố ra biển đánh cá, chị bán cá ngoài chợ. Những năm trước hoàn cảnh gia đình rất vất vả, do phải nuôi 5 người con đang tuổi ăn tuổi lớn, nguồn vốn vay lại khó khăn. Từ khi có Quỹ Tình thương về hoạt động tại địa bàn huyện nhà với cơ chế vay trả phù hợp nên chị Viết tham gia tích cực. Đồng vốn được sử dụng có hiệu quả, kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên rõ rệt. Thu nhập hiện tại của cả gia đình chị Viết là 180USD. Vòng vốn này chị quyết định vay 375USD để sắm thêm đồ nghề, phục vụ việc đánh bắt.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria P. is a single mother with three children For 6 years she has worked selling food outside of the Mayoreo market. She knows how to run her business well, and despite being a single mother, she has worked very hard to provide for her three children through the difficult times they have had as a family.

Since she was very young, she has been interested in preparing and selling food, and she ventured into this market out of necessity and her responsibility as a mother to her children. From the time she started working, the location was in poor condition, without a roof or walls, but once she began borrowing from Ceprodel and investing these funds, she has little by little built her business and now she needs to purchase cooking ingredients. Her greatest hope is to attract more customers in order to earn more money, which she will reinvest into her business and use for the necessities of her children at home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Translator.

Rosa Maria P. es madre soltera y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad. Desde hace 6 años se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en las afueras del mercado Mayoreo. Ha sabido administrar bien su negocio y a pesar de ser soltera, ha logrado con mucho esfuerzo mantener a sus tres hijos en medio de situaciones difíciles que como familia atraviesan. Desde muy pequeña se interesó por elaborar los alimentos y venderlos, incursiona en este mercado por la necesidad y responsabilidad que como madre debe tener hacia sus hijos. Al momento de iniciar su localidad estaba en pésimas condiciones sin techo ni pared pero a partir de que comenzó a realizar créditos en Ceprodel los ha invertido para construir poco a poco su negocio y a la vez para surtir de ingredientes para la comida. Su mayor anhelo es captar mas clientes para obtener mejores ganancias y reinvertirlo en su negocio y las necesidades de sus hijos en su hogar.

loans.use: To acquire cooking ingredients

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata J. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. She sells second-hand clothes in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone and has been doing this business for the past 4 years.

She is requesting a $700 loan to expand her business. She has been with the SMT program for 3 years and has experienced considerable progress in her business.

loans.use: Expand her clothing business by purchasing additional bales of clothing to resell

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Like many women in Sierra Leone, Mariatu runs a business of selling plastic sandals in Makeni town to supplement her husband’s income. She started her business with loan capital from SMT and would like to further expand the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $525 for the purpose.

loans.use: She would like to expand her business to include other items in addition to plastic sandals

loans.name: Milton Antonio

texts.es:
The business that Milton Mejia dedicates himself to is the sale of basic grains in the Mayoreo market. He is a young married man and with one son under his responsibility, this difficult economic situation he has to overcome by selling basic grains at the market with his wife. Since he was very young he has been characterized as being a hard worker, from the moment he decided to create a home he began his work with the most responsibility and consent to care for his nuclear family. The necessity that this young man has to fulfill is the remodeling of his store that from the moment he arrived at the market one year ago he found in a bad condition and it has been transforming very slowly now that he has received small loans from Ceprodel (5 credits) to achieve his dream of having a better store that is in good condition for the clients and to obtain better quantities of basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica Milton M. es a la venta de granos básicos en el mercado Mayoreo. Es un joven casado y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, la difícil situación económica que atraviesa junto a su esposa hace que incursione al mercado de la venta de granos básicos en esta localidad.

Desde muy niño se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, sin embargo desde el momento que decide formar un hogar inicia su trabajo con mayor responsabilidad y consiente que debe mantener su núcleo familiar. La necesidad que atraviesa este joven es la remodelación de su local ya que al momento que llegó al mercado hace una año se encontró con un local en malas condiciones por lo que lo ha venido transformando muy lentamente ya que ha realizado pequeños prestamos en Ceprodel (5 créditos) para así ver realizado su sueño de tener un mejor local que preste las condiciones necesarias para los clientes y de igual manera brindar mayores cantidades de granos básicos.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Bùi Thị Hoàn, 30 years old, is a TYM member since 2003. Before joining TYM, her family income came solely from the rice field that they exploited. They did not earn much money because the expenses were high (fertilizer is expensive). Ms Hoàn discussed with her husband and they decided to take out a loan to open a farming supply store. This helped increase their income and at the same time saved them money on the fertilizer that they buy because they get a better price as a business customer. Ms Hoàn also raises livestock. Her family financial situation has improved significantly. Her revenue is about 125 USD a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy more stock for her farm supply store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Hoàn, 30 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. Trước khi vào Quỹ nghề nghiệp chủ yếu của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, chi phí chăm bón cũng lớn nên kinh tế gia đình rất khó khăn. Chị Hoàn đã bàn bạc với chồng và quyết định vay vốn mở cửa hàng buôn bán đạm lân. Việc mở cửa hàng không những tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình mà còn giúp chị giảm chi phí chăm bón ruộng của gia đình (do mua buôn nên giá phân bón rẻ hơn). Kết hợp vào đó, chị Hoàn còn chăn nuôi và làm nẹp thúng bán. Nhờ thế kinh tế gia đình phát triển rõ rệt. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Hoàn là 125USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị định vay mức vốn 575USD để đầu tư mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho mùa vụ.

loans.use: Buy stock for her farm supply store

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata has been selling plastic sandals for more than three years. With her previous loans from SMT, she built her own capital and has increased her family income. School requirements are her major expenses and she would like to see her children through their education. The family’s main source of income is her business.  She would like to expand the business and be able to sell more in the village markets. She is therefore requesting a $700 loan.

loans.use: She would like to expand her business to the village markets, where she will be able to earn a greater profit

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata B. is married with a child. She runs a cosmetics business in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  With one child, 27 year old Fatmata would like to build a good family life for her child in future.  She would like to expand her business to earn sufficient income for the child's future education and to build a house for her family.  She is therefore requesting a $350 loan.

loans.use: Fatmata would like to expand her selection of cosmetics to sell in order to increase her profits

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs.Bui Thi X., 26 years old, joined the Fund since 2004. Her family currently has 4 members: the parents and 2 children. Her husband, Mr. Pham Van Hung, is a builder. When she did not have children yet, she sold dried food in the market and earned income for her family. This activity is convenient for paying back the money weekly. However, since she had 2 children, she could not work far away from home and as a result, her income decreased. To be able to take care of her children and to earn income for the family, she discussed with her husband and decided to borrow 450 USD to rebuild the pigpen and invest in breeding pigs. Her husband also helps her to pay back the money weekly. Her family income is 120 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị X., 26 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004. Gia đình chị hiện nay gồm 4 người: 2 vợ chồng và 2 cháu. Chồng chị, anh Phạm Văn Hùng, là một thợ xây. Khi chưa có cháu nhỏ chị X. buôn bán hàng khô ở chợ cũng tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Công việc này cũng thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Từ khi sinh cháu chị không đi làm xa được nên nguồn thu nhập cũng hạn chế. Để vừa chăm sóc con vừa lao động tạo thu nhập cho gia đình bớt khó khăn, chị bàn với chồng xin vay 450USD để sửa chữa chuồng trại đầu tư nuôi lợn. Nguồn hoàn trả hàng tuần do anh hỗ trợ. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 120USD.

loans.use: Repair pigpen and buy pigs

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Do Thi D., 58 years old, has been member of TYM Fund (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) since 2003. 3 out of her 4 children had moved out, so Mrs. D. now lives with her husband and her youngest child in Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province, Vietnam. Her job is to sell bamboo baskets. Each month she earns 80USD. Sometimes she makes baskets, too. Besides, she breeds a couple of pigs. After discussing with her husband, Mrs. D. would like to borrow 375USD to stock more baskets for the coming season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Đào, 58 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. 3 người con đầu đều đã trưởng thành, chị sống cùng với chồng và người con út tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Công việc hiện tại của chị Đào là buôn thúng, mang lại thu nhập hàng tháng là 80USD. Những lúc rãnh rỗi chị cũng tự đan thúng để bán, ngoài ra chị còn nuôi thêm vài con lợn. Vay vốn để buôn bán phải tính toán, lựa chọn thời điểm phù hợp thì mới có lợi nhuận cao. Vì vậy chị Đào đã bàn bạc với chồng xin vay mức vốn 375USD để mua thúng dự trữ đến thời điểm mùa vụ sẽ bán ra.

loans.use: Buy bamboo basket

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: 23 year old Hawa runs a business of selling bags, shoes and cotton materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Married with a child, her business is the family’s main source of income. Her husband assists her with the business after working as a casual laborer each day. Her hope is to expand her business and that is why she is requesting a $525 loan.

loans.use: To generate more income by increasing her stock of bags and shoes for sale in her general store

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi L., 52 years old, has been member of TYM Fund (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) since 1997. She has 3 children; two of them had moved out. Mrs. L. now lives with her husband and her youngest child. In the village, almost everybody does farming. Having quite a bit of land, Mrs. L. courageously decided to borrow 40USD to breed fish and plant flowers. Time bring more experiences. Now from each batch of fish, she earned 500-600USD. Her family's life quality has improved significantly. She is able to fix her house and buy some furniture. She'd like to borrow 375USD to buy food for fishes and fix a better pond.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Luân, 52 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1997. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và người con út, hai con đầu đều đã ra ở riêng. Vùng quê nơi gia đình chị sinh sống chủ yếu là nông nghiệp. Tận dụng lợi thế đất vườn ao rộng chị mạnh dạn vay 40USD về đầu tư vào nuôi cá và trồng hoa. Kinh nghiệm được tích luỹ dần qua các năm đến nay thu nhập mỗi lứa cá của gia đình đạt 500-600USD. Kinh tế gia đình chị Thịnh đã có nhiều thay đổi, chị đã làm được nhà mái bằng và sắm được một số tiện nghi trong nhà. Chị đang muốn vay thêm 375USD để đầu tư mua thức ăn cho cá cũng như sửa sang lại ao.

loans.use: Buy food for fishes

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi O., 43 years old, is living in Y Yen. She joined the Fund since 1998. Before joining the Fund, her family life is difficult because she did not own many rice fields and sending her children to school cost her lots of money. The local TYM Fund allowed Mrs.O. and other women to borrow money to run business. At first, Mrs. O. borrowed 40 USD to invest in breeding the pigs. As time passed by, she went from having 3,4 pigs to 20-30 pigs each farrow. Each year, she released 60-70 pigs from the pigsty. Her income from breeding the pigs allows her to send her children to school and build a nice house. This time, she wants to borrow 450 USD to buy more pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị O., 43 tuổi, sống tại Ý Yên tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Trước khi vào Quỹ gia đình kinh tế còn nhiều khó khăn do ruộng ít, chi phí cho các con đang ăn học lớn. Quỹ Tình thương về hoạt động tại địa bàn tạo điều kiện cho chị em phụ nữ nói chung và chị O. có điều kiện vay vốn làm ăn. Bước đầu chị vay mức vốn 40USD về đầu tư nuôi lợn. Qua các năm dần dần gia đình chị mở rộng thêm từ 3, 4 con ban đầu đến nay gia đình chị nuôi 20-30 con lợn mỗi lứa và mỗi năm xuất chuồng 60-70 con. Nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi giúp chị O. nuôi các con ăn học trưởng thành và xây nhà cửa khang trang. Vòng vốn tới chị O. muốn được tiếp tục vay thêm 450USD về để mua thức ăn cho lợn.

loans.use: Buy more pig mash

loans.name: Sarian

texts.en: Sarian is 38 years old and has been a SMT client for 3 years.  With her previous loans she was able to build her own capital and reduce the amount of goods she purchased on credit.  She made a good profit that has improved her family income and living status.  Married with 3 children, she would like to supplement her stock with the latest female fashion clothes. She would like to access a $525 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: She would like to add a variety of the latest female fashions to her clothing shop to attract new customers

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa C. started her business of selling cotton materials, including tie-dye at a very small scale.  With previous loans from SMT, she expanded her business to the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Hawa is married with 3 children and now she would like to diversify her business with other types of materials. She needs a loan of $350 for the purpose.

loans.use: She would like to expand her business to include different types of cotton materials for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie has five children. She runs a business selling palm oil and has been doing the same business for a long time.  With previous loans from SMT, she increased her stock and made a good profit.  She is able to send her children to school.  Married and 43 years old, Marie would like to expand her business by purchasing 80 gallons of palm oil. Marie believes that increasing her business will enable her to generate more income to build strong business capital to diversify the business.  She is requesting a $275 loan.

loans.use: She would like to purchase additional gallons of palm oil to meet the local demand

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu T. is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She runs her business in Makeni, Sierra Leone. With her previous loans she increased her stock of clothes and also increased her income. She would like to continue expanding her business and is requesting $350 to purchase 5 more bails of clothes.

loans.use: Increase her stock of clothing to sell to generate more income

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She prints cotton clothes and sells them wholesale and retail. Her income is solely from her business and she would like to expand it.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: She would like to create additional Gara tye and dye materials to sell in the market

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 30 years old and married with 5 children. Fatmata’s business supports her family’s expenses. With her previous loans from SMT, Fatmata has expanded her business and established a selling space in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Before the loans, Fatmata used to hawk from village to village with only one or two dozen plastic sandals.

She would like to expand her business and also construct a better place for the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $525.

loans.use: She would like to expand her selection of plastic sandals for sale to generate additional revenue for her business

loans.name: Sinneh

texts.en: Sinneh has been an SMT client for 4 years. Married with 3 children, the business is the only source of income for his family.  Sinneh said that with his previous loans his business expanded and income increased.  He has no problem now in meeting his family’s expenses, but he needs to expand his business to build his capital.  He is requesting a $700 loan.  Sinneh is 37 years old.

loans.use: To continue to build his business capital to help ensure the sustainability of his business and livelihood

loans.name: Valle Totora Group

texts.en:
The community bank “Valle Totora” was started 12 months ago. Now they have completed two cycles and have 15 associates. Valle Totera, which is also the community all of the members come from, is a small valley, which is known for agriculture and raising animals; the surrounding land produces vegetables and alfalfa.

In the community bank, the associates have learned to be responsible, punctual, to save, how to invest, how to run a business, how to educate their children, and how to improve their relationships with their husbands. The associates have various businesses such as selling groceries, fruits, vegetables, fish, sodas and other drinks, taxi driving, growing vegetables, and raising animals.

Every associate has a different history they can tell, such as Maria, who started her business one year ago selling a few products. With a loan from her community bank she was able to further develop her business. Today, her store has grown significantly and has many customers.

On the other hand, Ligia Perlita has been selling cebiche, a traditional dish maD. from raw marinated fish, for the past five years. She mentioned that with her loan she would be able to improve her business and prepare more cebiche.

The associates are requesting loans of different sizes; many only need 300, 450, 500, and 900 soles (3 soles = $1) making a total of 7, 050 soles in loans from the community bank.

They will invest these loans in buying roosters, medicinal herbs, oranges, lemons, bananas, and to buy tables and chairs for the “cebicheria”--a café where they serve cebiche.

They plan to use their savings to make sure their children are able to continue school, to increase the capital available for their businesses, and some even to build a house.

Many dream of owning their own house, or having a car to transport their products, and that their children will study and be able to become professionals.

loans.use: invest in and expand their various businesses

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu has five children and all are in school. As a widow, Isatu has to provide an income for the family. She sells fire wood in the out-skirts of Makeni town in Sierra Leone. Isatu finds it difficult to run her business without interruption during the rainy season as it is not easy for vehicles to go to the villages due to bad roads. Sufficient capital to purchase a big lorry of wood is an obstacle.

At the moment, Isatu is requesting a loan of $525 to purchase a good stock and store it for the rainy season. This will expand her business and increase her income. Isatu is 40 years old.

loans.use: Purchase an entire cart load of firewood to store for the rainy season when wood is in higher demand

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years old and married with 3 children. He sells second hand clothes in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Joseph would like to expand and diversify his business. He is therefore requesting a loan of $350 for this purpose.

loans.use: He would like to diversify his business further so that he can generate additional revenue

loans.name: John

texts.en: John K. sells second hand clothes in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  He purchases 3 – 4 bales of clothes every two weeks and has to travel to Freetown twice a month.  John believes if he could have enough capital to purchase the goods in bulk that he would increase his income and reduce time for traveling. At 45 years old, John K. believes a loan of $350 will enable him expand his business. John is married with 4 children.

loans.use: John would like to increase his income by reducing the amount of time and expense of traveling to Freetown to purchase clothing bales

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed K. is 38 years old and married with five children. He sells clothes in Makeni town and has been doing the same business for many years on a very small scale.

However with his previous loans from SMT, he increased his stock and income. Mohamed is happy with the loan scheme and is planning to continue with the program until he builds enough capital to diversify his business. The business is his only source of income and he would like a loan of $700 for its expansion.

loans.use: Mr. Kamara would like to continue to increase his business capital by slowly expanding his business

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou Ahiandzegbé is 35 years old, married, and has five (05) children. Her main business is the making of bouillie (a hot breakfast cereal) from local millet. She buys the millet in the neighbouring villages during the harvest, stocks it, and uses it during the rest of the year to make her bouillie, which is prized in the area. With this loan, she will buy 100 bags of millet in order to meet the demands of her customers. The income drawn from this business will be used to meet the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mme Akou Ahiandzegbé est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Sa principale activité est la fabrication de la bouillie du mil local. Elle achète le mil dans les villages environnant à la récolte, stock et l’utilise tout au long de l’année pour fabriquer de la bouillie très prisée dans le milieu. Avec le présent emprunt elle va acheter 100 sacs de mil afin de satisfaire la demande des consommateurs. Les revenus tirés de cette activité sont utilisés pour financer les dépenses courantes du ménage

loans.use: To buy 100 bags of local millet in the neighbouring villages and to transform it (throughout the year 2008) into 'bouillie' for local consumption

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is a 32 year old married mother of 3 children who runs her business in her homestead of Makeni. She sells peanuts and palm oil. Due to a lack of sufficient capital she could not earn enough profit to meet her family expenses.

With previous loans, she diversified the business to include palm oil. Isatu is an honest client who pays her loans on time. She is requesting another loan of $275 to purchase 89 gallons of palm oil and in the future she would like to start cross border trading in the Republic of Guinea.

loans.use: Isatu would like to purchase wholesale palm oil and sell it for a profit

loans.name: Anassie

texts.fr:
Anassie A. is married and has three (03) children. Her husband has a very irregular income. Her main business is a breadbaking, which she has been involved in for over 10 years. She buys bags of wheat which she then uses to make bread.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Anassie A. est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Son mari a un revenu très irrégulier. Sa principale activité est la boulangerie qu’elle exerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle achète des sacs de blé qu’elle transforme pour fabriquer du pain

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of wheat to make bread

loans.name: Elida Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elida Elizabeth, a member of the community bank "Los Jasmines", works selling groceries, bread products, household goods and cosmetics in a store located in her own house, which is located on the street Jr. Cajamarca, number 220, in the district and province of Moyabambo and the region of San Martín. She has enjoyed business since she was a young girl. When she separated from her husband she decided to start a business of her own as a way to help her 2 children move ahead.

With this loan of 3000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a variety of groceries including boxes of soap of different brands (marsella, bolivar and jumbo, for example), 50 kilogram sacks of rice, sugar and various legumes, packages of toilet paper, boxes of canned fish and fruit and liters of oil. Additionally, she will buy bread molds, sacks of flour, raisins and fruit preserves by the kilogram, culinary essences, bins of eggs, yeast, and boxes of milk.

Elida is 39 years old. She has always distinguished herself by being hardworking, perseverant and tenacious about getting ahead. She dreams of one day having her own vehicle with which to sell her breads in the country houses of the villages near her city.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elida Elizabeth, socia del Banco Comunal Los Jazmines, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panadería, pasamanería y cosméticos en una tienda ubicada en su propia casa, la cual se encuentra en el Jr. Cajamarca Nº 220, distrito y provincia de Moyabamba , departamento de San Martín. Desde muy pequeña le gustó el negocio y al separarse de su esposo decidió poner algo propio y así sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), sacos de 50 kilos de arroz, azúcar y menestras de diversos variedades, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, aceite por litros; además comprará moldes para panteón, harina en sacos, pasas y frutas confitadas en kilos, esencias, huevos en jabas y levadura y leche en cajas.

Elida tiene 39 años, siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante. Sueña con tener una movilidad propia para poder vender sus panes por los caseríos aledaños.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, legumes, etc.)

loans.name: Elidia

texts.es:
Elidia is tenacious about getting ahead. She is a member of the community bank "Corazones Valientes II" (Courageous Hearts) in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She lives in the San Martín region in the province of San Martín. Her business is located on the street Jr. Grau, on the corner of Jr, Ramírez Hurtado, across from the Plaza de Armas.
