texts.en: Kate I. is into the sale of groundnut oil and palm oil. She is a LAPO client, married with four children. She is 35 years old. She is from Edo State, and she is requesting for the loan of $375 to enable her buy more groundnut oil and palm oil to sell. She started this trade 8 years ago.

loans.use: To buy more oil to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married. She is retired from her previous work and lives in Zaporozhye. Valentina’s retirement pay was very small which is why she decided to start her own venture to support her family. She now sells household items in one of the local markets. She has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, Valentina has about $2000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1600. Her monthly net profit is about $1200.

Valentina wants to continue to grow and expand her business. She is planning to use this loan of $1200 to increase her stock and hopefully open a new vending facility in the future. She always tries to do familiar things in a different and better way and is constantly looking for innovative methods to do business. Valentina is hoping to persist in her entrepreneurial exercise and achieve stability and success.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie, a nurse by profession, owns a store for the sale of drugs. She is 38 years old, married with 2 children, and she is the leader of her Union and resides in Benin City. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more drugs to sell in her pharmacy. This, she hopes, will increase the quanity and quality of sales. She has been in business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceuticals to sell

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two kids. She is from Zaporozhye. She owns a small business selling clothing in the local city market. She has been in this trade for 5 years. Presently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $1600.

Yelena is hoping to use this loan of $1200 to open a new vending store and expand her trade. We believe her natural personality traits and desire to seek out opportunities and succeed will enable her to use the current loan most efficiently.

loans.use: To open a new store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Agharese

texts.en: O., who wants to buy more crates of drinks to sell, is asking for the loan of $450. She is 60 years old and married with seven children. She is the assistant leader of her Union, and is a member of the Benin tribe from Edo State. She learned her business for 12 months and has been in business since 2005.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nuru's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Nuru, age 32, is married with 3 children (ages 6, 3, and 2). She sells medicine for a living and began this business in 2002. She works from 7am to 10pm daily, and now makes a monthly profit of about $325 from this business.

Nuru hopes to take out a loan to buy more inventory to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in food and general items sales.

loans.use: To buy medicine inventory

loans.name: Halima's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Halima, age 35, is married with 3 children (ages 18, 15, and 12). She has a business of selling spare parts, which started in 1998. She works from 7am to 12pm daily, and this business brings a monthly profit of about $280 from the sales.

Halima hopes to expand her inventory with a loan, which she will share with her subgroup. Her subgroup has businesses in food and stationery sales.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Ewere

texts.en: L. is into the sale of building (construction) materials. He is single and 35 years old. He is a LAPO client and a resident of Edo State. He is asking for the loan $375 to buy more building materials to sell. He learned his business for 5 years and has been in business since 2005.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, age 35, is married with a 5-year-old child. She started a business of selling clothes and shoes in 2004. She works daily from 11am to 2pm. In a month, her sales bring her about $35 in profit after inventory costs of about $135.

Bahati would like a loan to buy more stock to sell. She belongs to the loan group, Umoja, which totals 40 members who ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity, who is into the sale of clothes, needs the assistance of the loan of $550 to buy more clothes to sell. She is married with 7 children and she is 47 years old. She is the leader of her union. She has been in the business since 1997.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mwamvua

texts.en:
Mwamvua, age 37, is married with 3 children (ages 17, 15, and 13). She has a clothes selling business which she began in 2004. She works from 8am to noon every day, and now makes a monthly profit of about $168 from her sales.

Mwamvua hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She belongs to the loan group, Nguvu Kazi, totaling 36 members who ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is into the sales of clothes. She is 44 years old, married with 2 children. She is the secretary of her union. She is asking for the loan of $450 to buy more clothes to sell. She learned the business for 12 months and has been in it since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, who is into the clothing business, is married with three children. She is 59 years old. She is currently the leader of her group and a member of the Bini tribe. She is asking for the loan of $700 to buy more clothes to sell. She learned her business from her mother for 2 years and has been in it since 1987.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. sells clothes and also sews clothes for people living in her community. She is married with 9 children, and she is 50 years old and a LAPO member. She is asking for the loan of $525 to buy more clothes for sale and also to expand her business. She learned her business for 12 months and has been in it since 1985.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ikpomwonsa

texts.en: Mr. O. is married with children and is 38 years old. He is into photography and video coverage. He is from Edo State, and he is asking for the loan of $275 in order to purchase a camera, and also for other materials needed to add beauty to his studio. He learned his trade for 3 years and has been in it since 1995.

loans.use: To purchase a camera, and other materials needed to add more beauty to the studio

loans.name: Zainabu's Cafe Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, age 31, is divorced with a 17-year-old child who lives with her.  She owns a cafe, which she started in 2005.  She works at her cafe from 8am to 6pm daily, and currently makes a monthly profit of about $110 from this business.

Zainabu hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her cafe.  She belongs to a loan group called Baraka (Swahili for "Blessing"), totaling 25 members who ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food items for her cafe

loans.name: Ekamah

texts.en: Mrs. Ekamah runs a restaurant business. She is 47 years old, married with three children. She is from Edo State and a member of LAPO. She needs the loan of $275 to buy more drinks and food to sell. She learned her business for 3 years and has been in it since 1989.

loans.use: To buy drinks for sale

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate owns a hair salon. She is married with 4 children and is 37 years old. She is a LAPO member and from the Bini tribe from Edo State. She needs the loan amount of $275 to buy weavon (for hair styling), hair accessories and drinks for sale. She started the business in 1991.

loans.use: To buy weavon for hair styling and drinks to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy, who trades in provisions, is married with 5 children and she is 43 years old. She is from Edo state. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She learned business for a year and has been in it since 1990.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Ms. Maria Teresa R. has been living in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood for 10 years. This is the place where she had hoped to find a better life for her 4 children, who are all adults now and assist with the household expenses. Ms. R. has a mini market that has been steadily growing over the past few years, but unfortunately she has not generated sufficient funds for building a protective wall in front of her house that will provide security for her business. Due to her neighborhood’s high crime rate, she has found the need to build this wall so as to protect her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Teresa habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación desde hace 10 años. Lugar donde esperó encontrar una mejor vida con sus cuatros hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. Doña Maria Teresa tiene un pulpería la cual ha venido creciendo con el pasar de los años, pero lastimosamente el dinero no le ha dado para poder asegurar su negocio al construir el muro delantero de su casa. Debido a la situación tan peligrosa por la que pasa el barrio, se le ha vuelto una nacesidad poder construir el muro, para asegurar su negocio.

loans.use: Construction of protective brick wall in front of her house

loans.name: Mayra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Mayra C. is a single mother of 3 underage children. It has cost her a great deal to get ahead in life, and she has made many sacrifices in order to be able to start a business in her home. She says that with the help of God, however, she has been able to move forward, and now she has a mini market. Ms. C. would like to offer her children more comfort, which is why she would like to invest in the purchase of grains, beans, and perishable goods in order to boost sales, thus allowing her to save enough money for her biggest aspiration for the moment: renovating her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mayra es madre soltera y tiene 3 niños menores de edad. Le ha costado mucho poder salir adelante y ha tenido que sacrificar mucho para poder empezar un negocio de ventas de productos varios en su casa, pero ella dice que con la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante y hoy en día su negocio ya es una pequeña tienda. Doña Mayra quiere otorgarle mejor comodidad a sus pequeños, por lo que desea invertir en la compra de granos básicos y productos perecederos para aumentar las ventas de su tienda, para así poder comenzar a ahorrar y poder mejorar la construcción de su casa que por el momento es su mayor aspiración.

loans.use: Purchase of grains, beans, and perishable goods

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Luisa T. is a 42-year-old married mother of a 16-year-old daughter. Because of her husband’s lack of job stability, Mrs. T. found herself needing to set up a fast food business, which she has been running for three years. She operates the business from her own home situated in the Reparto España of Managua. Over the past three years, her business has been growing because she has many customers, which is why Mrs. T. and her husband are fully dedicated to their business. Mrs. T. would like to expand her business and someday set up a dining area, which is why she is requesting the loan. She wants to invest in her business by buying meat, vegetables, and spices so that she can keep cooking and selling her food, thus giving her the opportunity to offer her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Luisa tiene 42 años, casada y con una hija de 16 años. Debido a la inestibilidad del trabajo de su esposo, Doña Luisa se vió en la necesidad de crear un negocio de venta de comida, en el cual lleva ya tres años. El negocio lo tiene en su casa, ella habita en el Reparto España de Managua. En estos tres años el negocio ha crecido mucho y son ya muchos clientes a los que le provee comida, es por eso que Doña Luisa y su esposo están dedicados de lleno al negocio. Doña Luisa quiere hacer su negocio más grande y llegar a poner un comedor, es por eso que necesita el crédito, para seguir inviertiendo, comprando carne, verduras y especies para seguir cocinando y vendiendo su comida, para así poder dar una mejor vida a su familia

loans.use: Purchase of meat, vegetables, and spices for her fast food business

loans.name: Radojka

texts.en: Radojka is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Lukavica, East Sarajevo. She is married and has a son who is self-employed. Radojka has taken 2 previous loans through MCO WWI, and she used them to buy equipment for her tailoring shop. Her husband works, too, but his income is not enough to help Radojka realize her idea of expanding her tailoring services. By expanding her tailoring services, Radojka will realize her old dream and improve her material situation.

loans.use: Expanding tailor services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his goods

loans.name: Francisco Gerardo

texts.es:
Francisco Gerardo is a man who has known how to obtain benefits from his own business and move ahead in spite of not having a family to fight for. Time ago he worked in a bookstore and there he learned how to administer a bookstore. A year ago he opened his own business and thanks to his effort and will to move ahead as well as to offer good books, he is now recognized by his community.

Nevertheless, during this period of time people start to buy more books and therefore Francisco is requesting a loan of $925 to be repaid in 6 months, and with this money he will buy more books in order to offer more variety. He also wishes to redesign his bookstore to be more competitive. With your support Francisco will be able to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco Gerardo es un hombre que a pesar de no tener una familia por quien luchar, ah sabido obtener beneficios de poner su propio negocio y a podido salir adelante. Hace tiempo trabajó en una librería, y fue ahí donde aprendió todo lo necesario para poder administrar una librería. Hace un año que comenzó con este negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas por salir adelante, además de proveer buenos libros a podido establecerse entre su comunidad.

Sin embargo en estas fechas la gente comienza a comprar más libros. es por eso que Francisco está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Francisco podrá comprar más libros para poder tener surtido. Además de poder remodelar un poco su librería para poder tener mayor presencia en el mercado. Con tu ayuda Francisco podrá salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase more and varied books to be more competitive.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco started selling some sweets as part of his retirement plans and little by little he obtained clients who are asking for more variety, and presently he has been able to set up a business where he sells his candies.

Nevertheless, don Juan Francisco wishes to increase earnings for his wife and family. Therefore Juan is requesting a loan of $150.00 to be repaid in 6 months in order to purchase more merchandise. With your support Juan may move ahead and obtain an income in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Juan Francisco en el año 2000 pensando en su jubilación, comenzó a vender pocos dulces, y poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientes, los cuales le iban pidiendo más variedad, hasta que logró poner su localito de venta de dulces que tiene actualmente.

Sin embargo Juan Francisco desea superarse más para así poder sacar dinero para su esposa y su familia. Es por eso que Juan está solicitando un crédito de US $150 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Juan podrá surtir más su local y así poderse establecer. Con tu ayuda Juan saldrá adelante y tener un ingreso en el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of candy to increase earnings.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña María Guadalupe has been selling used garments for the past 20 years. She started because she had been out of work for some time and her children needed things which she couldn’t afford with her husband’s small income. With her savings she started to buy clothes in Villa Hidalgo and San Juan to sell to her neighbors who would pay in small installments every two weeks. Little by little she increased the number of clients and that way she has supported her 4 children.

Nevertheless, presently the selection of garments is poor and therefore she requests a loan of $925 to be repaid in 6 months. With this loan doña María can purchase new and varied merchandise to offer her clients. With your support María will be able to increase business and save money for her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María Guadalupe hace 20 años que se dedica a vender ropa usada. Comenzó debido a duró mucho tiempo sin encontrar trabajo. Además que sus hijos necesitaban cosas y ella no podía comprárselas con el poco dinero que ganaba su esposo. Fue así que empezó a comprar con unos ahorritos ropa en Villa Hidalgo y en San Juan, para vendérselas a sus vecinas y que éstas a su vez pagaran sus productos en abonos pequeños quincenales. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de créditos y es así como a podido mantener a sus 4 hijos.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con mucho surtido. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía nueva para poder tener algo nuevo qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante su negocio y además de juntar dinero para los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase more and varied garments to improve sales.

loans.name: Anarsih

texts.en: Anarsih, 42, is a mother of 3 children. Her husband, E., sells waste materials and earns USD21 a week. To supplement her husband's income, she sells vegetables such as chilis, onions, etc., earning USD5 a day. She needs a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
20 years ago doña Ofelia started selling her and her 5 children’s used garments as she did not have enough money to feed her 5 children. She started placing the clothes on a sheet outside her home and little by little the business started growing thanks to her enthusiasm. Ofelia managed to make her children keep going and now they have their own families. Presently there are more clients for her second-hand garments and therefore Ofelia buys clothes at the border.

Nevertheless after the holiday season Ofelia does not have garments to offer and therefore she is requesting a loan of $925.00 to be repaid in 6 months and with this money she will purchase clothing in bulk to offer more variety. With your support doña Ofelia may earn enough to meet the expenses of herself and her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hace ya 20 años que Ofelia comenzó a vender ropa de ella y de sus 5 hijos. Puesto que no contaba con el dinero suficiente como para poder mantener a sus 5 hijos. En un inicio tendía una sábana fuera de su casa y encima ponía toda la ropa. Poco a poco se comenzó a administrar y a crecer su negocio y gracias a su entusiasmo Ofelia logró sacar adelante a todos sus hijos quienes ya son padres de familia. Actualmente ya tiene más clientes que la buscan para comprarle ropa de segunda. Es por eso que Ofelia se va a surtir de ropa a la frontera.

Sin embargo después de la temporada de fiestas Ofelia no cuenta con ropa nueva para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes y es por eso que Ofelia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ofelia podrá surtirse de pacas de ropa para poder brindar novedades a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ofelia podrá sacar dinero para poder pagar los gastos de ella y su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sale of used garments.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Angela is a hard-working woman and she always wants to giver her 6 children the best and she started selling beauty products in 1999 to this end, following an invitation from her friend to help her with the sales. After some time of selling beauty products she started to make an sell tamales on the weekends and then she started her sales by catalogue. For a short time she also sold ceramics but many of her patrons were not forthcoming in their payments, so she stopped this activity. The major reason why she had these business was so that her children could pursue their studies for as long as they needed, so that they may have a better future.

Angela's 6 children are now married and thanks to her dedication and efforts she was able to provide for them, and she feels happy that she was able to meet her goal. But life has not finished at this point. Angela now has a new goal, she wants to establish her business selling tamales. Through this she will be able to save money for that day when she will no longer be able to work. For this reason Angela is requesting a loan of US$475 which she is ready to repay in a term of 5 months. With this money Angela will be able to pruchase the ingredients necessary to make her tamales. She will be able to provide more merchandise and will be able to fill orders. With your help Angela will be able to make her business a success. She will be able to save for her retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual desea siempre brindarles lo mejor a sus 6 hijos fue por eso que en 1999, comenzó a vender productos de belleza, a raíz de que una amiga la invitó a una demostración y le pidió que la ayudara a vender; después de un tiempo de venta de cosméticos comenzó a elaborar y vender tamales los fines de semana y después empezó a vender productos por catálogo. En un tiempo también se dedicó a la venta de cerámica pero mucha gente pagaba mal por lo que dejó de dedicarse a esta actividad. La razón principal por la que tuvo todos estos negocios era para que sus hijos estudiaran lo más que ellos quisieran para así poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro.

Actualmente los 6 hijos de Ángela están casados y gracias a su dedicación y esfuerzo por sacar adelante a sus hijos fue que ella se siente contenta por haber logrado su meta. Sin embargo la vida no termina en este punto. Y es por eso que Ángela tiene una nueva meta. Que es la de establecer su negocio de venta de tamales. Para así poder ahorrar dinero para el momento en que no puedan trabajar. Es por eso que Ángela está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Ángela podrá comprar lo necesario para poder elaborar sus tamales. Y así poder tener más mercancía para ofrecer y para hacer pedidos que le han pedido por mayoreo. Con tu ayuda Ángela podrá salir adelante en su negocio. Y así formar un patrimonio para su retiro.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make tamales and to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio C. D. is married and has a 2 year old daughter. He got married very young, and he started looking for a job in order to support his wife and daughter. However, his search was not successful. His parents, with whom they live at the moment, recommended and helped him in 2004 to open a stand to sell fruits and vegetables, and that is how he started his own business, with which he hopes to get ahead and be able to buy a house for his wife and daughter. Currently he has a steady list of clients that buy different products from him.

Julio wishes to expand his business by buying more fruits and vegetables of the season. That is why he is requesting a $475 loan which he will repay in 5 months. With this money, Julio will be able to buy not only more merchandise, but also expand his business so that he can offer a better service to his clients. With your help Julio will be able to save enough money so that he can offer a house to his wife and daughter where they all can live and grow old together.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio C. Díaz, está casado y tiene una hija de 2 años. Sin embargo Julio se casó muy joven, es por eso que comenzó a buscar trabajo para poder mantener los gastos de su hija y de su esposa. Sin embargo la búsqueda era fallida. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, que es con quien está viviendo actualmente, que en el 2004 le recomendó y ayudó a hincar un negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, fue como comenzó a hacerse de su propio negocio, para poder salir adelante y en un futuro poder tener una casa para él y su esposa e hija. Actualmente ya cuenta con varios clientes que cada vez le van solicitando diferentes cosas.

Julio Desea crecer su negocio comprando más frutas y verduras de la temporada. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Julio podrá surtir su negocio además de ampliarlo un poco para así poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Julio podrá juntar dinero para poder ofrecerle una casa a su esposa e hija. Y así crecer juntos.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for his busines

loans.name: Badriyah

texts.en: Badriyah, 45, is a mother of 3 children. While her husband, D., works as a teacher and earns USD10.5 a month, she sells waste materials such as plastic bottles, etc., earning USD1 a day. She asks for a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Mr. Denis is a 65 year old married man. He lives with his wife, his 17 year old daughter and his grandson. Mr. Denis is retired, and he receives his pension every month, but that money is not enough to feed his whole family, since he is the sole breadwinner. He makes windows for houses. He has 30 years of experience, and all of his work is done by hand by melting aluminum in order to shape the window. He is a very dedicated worker, and as such he has a good reputation in the area of Memorial Sandino where he lives. He needs the loan in order to buy aluminum, glass and rivets so that he can keep on making windows and meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Denis tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, con una hija de 17 años, vive con su esposa, hija y un nieto.Don Denis es jubilado y recibe mensualmente dinero del seguro social, pero este dinero es muy poco para alimentar a su familia, ya que es el único sostén de ella. Trabaja haciendo ventanas para las casas de habitación, tiene 30 años de experiencia, y todo este trabajo lo hace artesanalmente, la manera en que lo hace es fundiendo el aluminio para darle forma a la ventana. La dedicación que pone en su trabajo lo ha hecho merecedor de una muy buena fama en el barrio Memorial Sandino donde éste reside; es por eso que necesita el crédito para comprar aluminio, vidrio y remaches para seguir haciendo ventanas y poder suplir las necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy aluminum, glass, and rivets for his business.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio Cesar D. is married and has a 2 year old daughter. However, Julio got married very young and in order to afford the expenses to support his wife and daughter, he started looking for work. However his search for work failed. Thanks to support from his parents, with whom they currently live, he started a business selling fruits and vegetables. This is how he started to work for himself and to support his family. He hopes his business will enable them to have a home of their own in the future. He currently has various clients who have started to request a greater variety of products.

Julio would like to grow his business by purchasing more fruits and vegetables that are in season. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $475, which he is willing to pay back over the course of 5 months. With this money, Julio will be able to stock and expand his business and offer a better service to his clients. With your help, Julio will be able to save enough money to provide his wife and daughter with a home where they can live together.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio Cesar D., está casado y tiene una hija de 2 años. Sin embargo Julio se casó muy joven, es por eso que comenzó a buscar trabajo para poder mantener los gastos de su hija y de su esposa. Sin embargo la búsqueda era fallida. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, que es con quien está viviendo actualmente, que en el 2004 le recomendó y ayudó a hincar un negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, fue como comenzó a hacerse de su propio negocio, para poder salir adelante y en un futuro poder tener una casa para él y su esposa e hija. Actualmente ya cuenta con varios clientes que cada vez le van solicitando diferentes cosas.

Julio Desea crecer su negocio comprando más frutas y verduras de la temporada. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Julio podrá surtir su negocio además de ampliarlo un poco para así poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Julio podrá juntar dinero para poder ofrecerle una casa a su esposa e hija. Y así crecer juntos.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Filena

texts.es:
Mrs. Filena G. is a 51-year-old married mother of 4 grown-up children who no longer live with her. She lives with her husband in the 14 de Febrero neighborhood of Managua. Mrs. G. sells clothing, shoes, and cosmetics both as a street vendor and from her own home. She started this business years ago because she needed the money in order to provide an education for her four children, since her husband did not generate enough income to cover the household expenses. She would like to invest in her business by building a protective wall in front of her house because the wall is not yet complete. Mrs. G. would like to feel safe in her home and ensure the security of the merchandise she keeps there.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Filena tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, con 4 hijos mayores de edad, que ya no viven con ella. Vive con su esposo en el barrio 14 de Febrero de Managua. Doña Filena es vendedora de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, en su casa de habitación y también ambulante. Empezó en este negocio hace mucho tiempo porque necesitaba el dinero para poder darles eduación a sus cuatro hijos, ya que lo que ganaba su esposo era muy poco para toda la familia. Quiere invertir en su negocio para poder construir el muro de su vivenda, ya que este no se encuentra terminado completamente. Doña Filena quiere sentirse segura en su casa y asegurar también la amercadería que ahí tiene.

loans.use: Purchase of cinder blocks, cement, and iron for construction of protective wall in front of her house

loans.name: Sundayah

texts.en: Sundayah, 35, together with her husband, P., raise ducks at their house. They sell their duck eggs, earning USD17 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to buy more ducks to raise. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Mariela Zuzed

texts.es:
Since Mariela's parents did not make enough money to pay for her sibling's studies, Mariela started to work at a record store to provide some financial support at home. On February of 2005, one of Mariela's coworkers invited her to join a group of vendors who sold plastic kitchen products. Mariela accepted and started selling these items in her spare time. Later on, she was married and stopped working at the record store, but continued to sell her merchandise.

However, she currently has a few orders she has not been able to fulfill. For this reason she requests a loan of $475 which she is willing to pay back over the course of 5 months. With this money, Mariela will be able to buy the products her clients are asking for. In addition, it will enable her to buy a greater selection of items and offer her clients new merchandise. With your help, Mariela will be able to financially aid her husband and provide a better future for the children they one day would like to have.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Debido a que los papás de Mariela, no tenían un ingreso suficiente como para pagar los gastos del estudio de sus hermanos. Fue como Mariela decidió ponerse a trabajar en una tienda de discos para poder apoyar en su casa. En Febrero del 2005, una compañera del trabajo de Mariela la invitó a formar parte de un grupo de vendedoras de productos de plástico para la cocina y Mariela aceptó y empezó a vender dichos productos en sus ratos libres; después se casó y dejó de trabajar en la tienda de discos pero se siguió dedicando a la venta de los productos.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene unos pedidos que no a podido surtir. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Mariela podrá comprar los productos que le están pidiendo. Además de comprar un poco más de surtido para así poder tener nuevos productos que ofrecerle a todos sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Mariela podrá ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante para poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro a los hijos que quieren tener.

loans.use: Purchase products ordered

loans.name: Lailah

texts.en: Lailah, 40, is a mother of 7 children. Her husband, R., has been unemployed for a long time, so she has to earn income for the family by herself. She sells small potatoes, earning USD4 a day. She requests a loan of USD 75 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Blanca Lili

texts.es:
Blanca is a woman that has firmly resolved to provide for her 3 children, and to provide them with a University education so that they will have better opportunities than she has had. She is worried about being able to start paying the university tuition of her eldest son who is almost ready to graduate. This is why she started to sell products by catalogue in 2006, and she started selling second-hand clothing. She dedicates her time to selling the used clothing because she earns more money this way. Slowly Blanca has formed her clientele.

But Blanca does not have enough merchandise to offer her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan of US$475 which she is ready to repay in a 5-month term. With this money Blanca will be able to purchase merchandise and be able to offer her clients new products. With your help Blanca and her husband will be able to cover their children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una mujer que tiene el firme propósito de sacar a sus 3 hijos adelante, y brindarles estudios Universitarios para que éstos puedan tener mejores oportunidades que ella Actualmente está más preocupada por poder comenzar a pagar los gastos que genere la universidad de su hijo el mayor a quien le falta poco para que salga. Es por eso que comenzó a vender productos por catálogo en el 2006, sin embargo poco a poco fue ofreciendo ropa de segunda, la cuál se dedica más tiempo puesto que la venta de estos productos deja mayores ganancias. Poco a poco Blanca ha ido formando un grupo de clientela.

Sin embargo Blanca no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Blanca podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener productos nuevos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Blanca y su esposo podrán pagarles los estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa's husband is a plumber, a trade with inconsistent demand. Consequently he has been out of money during long periods of time on various occasions. It is for this reason that Felipa decided t start her own business to help her husband with household expenses. In 2004, a friend of hers invited her to sell cosmetics by catalogue and at this point started her business. Thanks to all her acquaintances and family members, she sold all her initial products. Her clients were so pleased, they started to recommend her among their respective friends. Today, Felipa has a much larger clientele.

Nonetheless, Felipa wishes to expand and strengthen her business. For this reason, Felipa is requesting a loan of $475 which she is willing to pay back over the course of 5 months. With this money, she will buy products to be able to offer something new to her clients. With your help, she will be able to get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Felipa es plomero y este oficio no es muy constante, es por eso que en varias ocasiones se queda una larga temporada sin dinero. Es por eso que Felipa decidió comenzar su propio negocio para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del Hogar. En el 2004 una amiga de ella la invitó a vender cosméticos por catálogo. Fue ahí donde comenzó en este negocio. Gracias a los conocidos que tiene y sus familiares vendió sus primeros productos. Y tal fue el agrado de estos clientes, que comenzaron a recomendarla entre sus demás amistades. Actualmente Felipa ya cuenta con un mayor grupo de clientela.

Sin embargo Felipa desea crecer y que su negocio se consolide. Es por eso que Felipa está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Felipa podrá comprar sus productos para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs the loan to purchase goods and to pay for an operation

loans.name: Silvia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Silvia started her silver jewelry business in order to help her husband with family expenses. Her husband is a security man and his earnings were not enough to cover the expenses of their son who is two years old. Silvia started selling silver among her family members, neighbors and friends and now counts on a larger number of clients.

However, she currently does not have enough merchandise to offer her clients. This is why Silvia is requesting a loan of $250, which she is willing to pay back over the course of 3 months. With this money, Silvia will be able to buy a batch of silver jewelry to have a better selection of products, and in turn have more clients and obtain extra income for her home. With your help, Silvia and her family will forge ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia inició su negocio de venta de platería, para poder ayudarle en los gastos familiares a su esposo, quien trabaja como vigilante y con lo que gana no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de su hijo quien tiene dos años. Silvia inició vendiendo plata entre sus familiares, vecinos y amigos y actualmente ya cuenta con un mayor número de clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente, no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes es por eso que Silvia está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Silvia podrá comprar un lote de plata para poder tener más surtido en sus productos y así poder tener más clientes para poder obtener ingresos extras para su casa. Con tu ayuda Silvia podrá salir adelante junto con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase a batch of silver jewlery

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe started selling used clothes three years ago. Little by little she obtained clients and started to acquire new clothing to sell to those who desired other types of merchandise. Currently, she has a wide client base. However, María would like her business to continue growing since she has three sons that she would like to provide a better future for through education.

This is why María is requesting a loan of $250 and is willing to pay back over the course of 3 months. With this money, María will be able to buy bulk merchandise at a better buying price, which in turn will yield higher revenues. With your aid, María will be able to help her three sons get ahead and assist her partner with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe comenzó hace tres años a vender ropa usada, poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes, e ingresó ropa nueva para venderle a los clientes que desean otro tipo de productos. Actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo amplio de clientes. Sin embargo María desea que su negocio siga creciendo, puesto que tiene tres hijos a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro a base de estudios.

Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía por mayoreo puesto que es así como le hacen un mejor precio y poder obtener mayores ganancias. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus tres hijos y ayudarle a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Andrea De Lourdes

texts.es:
Andrea de Lourdes is a single mother of a little boy of 2 years, which she wants to provide a better future for him, one better than hers. Four years ago, Andrea started to sell used clothing to among her family and neighbours. Later on she started to see an increase in business and decided to add to her shop some jewelery sales, and slowly she has been increasing her clientele, and of consequently increasing her business.

For this Andrea is requesting a credit of US$250 which she is ready to repay in a term of 3 months. With this loan Andrea will be able to purchase more clothing and jewelery and therefore increase her selection and finally earn money to cover her son's expenses. With your help Andrea will be able to support her small family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Andrea de Lourdes es madre soltera de un pequeño de 2 años, al cual desea brindarle un futuro mejor que el de ella. Hace 4 años, Andrea comenzó a vender ropa usada entre sus familiares y vecinos. Posteriormente comenzó a incrementar la competencia y decidió agregarle a su negocio la venta de joyería, poco a poco se ha ido incrementando su clientela, sin embargo la competencia también.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and silver jewelery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hairpieces and beverages to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu owns a small table shop in the town market of Makeni, in Sierra Leone.  She started by selling salt and onions, and with her previous loans from SMT, she diversified her business.  Kadiatu’s hope is to own a kiosk in the same market and expand her business.  She is requesting a 1,500,000 Leone loan for the purpose.  Kadiatu is 45 years old and married with 3 children.  Her business profit supplements her husband’s meagre income.

loans.use: Kadiatu would like to expand her business so that she can begin to purchase a store front of her own.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul B. is a father of five children and pays their education expenses from the profits from the business.  Because of small loans from SMT, Abdul still takes some of the business items from the merchants on credit, which does not provide him with good profits. For two years, SMT has been working with Abdul and found him to be honest and hard working.  Abdul is requesting another loan to expand his business and build his own capital.  He would also like to involve his wife in the daily management of the business. Abdul is 36 years old.

loans.use: Abdul would like to expand his business so that his wife can help contribute to the success of the business.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan Gabriel works as a sorter in a soft drink factory. What he earns there, however, is not enough to support his two daughters, both of whom are studying so that they can have a better future. Even though his daughters are only 10 and 13 right now, he is already saving money for their education at a university. In January of 2006, Juan Gabriel opened a small stand outside of his home and began selling new and used clothes. Once he saw that the business was becoming known he began to also sell soft drinks, cookies and plants. He commented, "The idea is to make the business grow bit by bit."

With this goal in mind, he is asking for a loan of $650. He is ready to repay this loan over a period of 5 months. With the money, he will be able to buy more merchandise so that he can have something new to offer his customers. With your help Juan will be able to succeed and thus give his daughters a better future.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Gabriel, trabaja como repartidor en una empresa de venta de refrescos, sin embargo, con lo que gana no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus 2 hijas, a quienes tiene estudiando para que éstas puedan tener un mejor futuro. Actualmente sus hijas tienen 13 y 10 años, sin embargo Juan Gabriel desea ahorrar dinero para sus estudios universitarios. En Enero del 2006, gracias a su visión, Juan Gabriel, abrió un pequeño localito fuera de su casa, comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y nueva, y después de que vio que el negocio se iba haciendo conocido fue como ingresó en el local venta de refrescos, y después galletas y botanas. “La idea es ir agrandando el negocio poco a poco” comentó.

Y con esta meta, es con la que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Juan podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Juan podrá sacar su negocio adelante. Además de poder ofrecerle a sus hijas un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha sells basic items in the open market, in Makeni town.  His wife is engaged in petty trading to supplement the family income.  With his previous loans from SMT, he diversified the business and assisted his wife in starting a small business selling palm oil.  Alpha will complete repayments on his loan installments in late January and would like another loan to further expand his business.  Alpha is 35 years old with four children.

loans.use: Alpha would like to diversify his business and help it to grow.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
In 2000, Maria Guadalupe began selling gifts and beauty products in her house in order to supplement the money her husband earns as a worker in the United States. Gradually Maria realized that selling gifts was not enough and started to sell stationary items too; now she is most associated with that trade in her area.

Nevertheless, she doesn't have enough variety in the things she sells. It is for this reason that Maria is asking for a loan of $600. She is willing to repay this loan over a period of 6 months. With this money Maria will be able to purchase more merchandise, with which she will get more customers who are searching for things she didn't sell before. With your help Maria will be able to succeed. Once she does so her husband will be able to leave the United States and return to his family.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

En el 2000 María Guadalupe comenzó a vender artículos de regalo y de belleza en su casa, para poder sacar dinero para poder obtener ingresos extras a lo que gana el esposo puesto que se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar y María necesitaba de un negocio que le pudiera dar dinero en lo que su esposo le mandaba. Poco a poco María se fue dando cuenta que el negocio de los regalos no era suficiente y fue así como comenzó a vender artículos de papelería y con este giro es con el que se está identificando más en su colonia.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente variedad en los artículos, es por es oque María está solicitando un crédito de US $600 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía y así podrá captar más clientes que buscan cosas que antes no tenía María. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir adelante, para que ya no haya necesidad de que su esposo trabaje en EUA y regrese con su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. Her husband has been driving a taxi for a few years. (Her husband is pictured). His name is Ibadet. He needs a loan in amount of $600, he plans to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair car

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
In 1998 Rose began selling gifts outside her home. Previously she had begun to sell lingerie, but once she saw that people bought other types of presents, she expanded her business to sell jewels and silver jewelry. Gradually, she has made her way in the world of commerce. The main idea for which Rose began this business is because she is a single mother with three children who she previously supported by cleaning houses. Since she wanted to make sure that her children could study, she started this business to cover those costs.

Rosa wants to further grow her business; this is why she is asking for a loan of $800, which she will be able to repay within 6 months. With this money Rosa will be able to buy a greater variety of products and will thus keep all of her customers. With your assistance, Rosa will help her children succeed.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

En 1998 Rosa comenzó a vender regalos y detalles fuera de su casa. Posteriormente comenzó a vender otros productos de lencería, y poco después que vio que la gente comenzaba a buscar otro tipo de regalos, agregó a su negocio la venta de bisutería y joyería de plata. Poco a poco se ha ido abriendo camino en el mundo del comercio. La idea principal por la que Rosa comenzó este negocio es porque es madre soltera de tres hijos a quienes ella a mantenido limpiando casas. Sin embargo ella desea que sus hijos puedan estudiar es por eso que comenzó con el negocio para así poder pagarles los estudios a sus hijos.

Sin embargo Rosa desea crecer más su negocio es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $800 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero Rosa podrá comprar más variedad en sus productos y así poder mantener cautivos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. 

She sells clothing in the Beylagan city bazaar. She started her business ten years ago. She's requesting a loan of $900 to buy more kinds of goods to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Luis Raúl

texts.es:
Luis Raul is a young man that wants to progress in life. Currently he is studying during the weekend, and in the weekdays he sells used clothing items. His parents do not have enough money to pay for his school and he did not want to be an additional burden for them, so that is why in 2005 he started working with a woman that sells used clothing and slowly he was able to be independent and get his own business. “My dream is to finish my professional studies and then start my own company, and that is why I started this small business that will allow me to continue with my studies”, he says.

Currently Luis does not have enough merchandise to offer to his clients, and that is why he is asking for a $750 loan which he will repay in 6 months. With that money, Luis will be able to buy merchandise that he will be able to offer to his clients. With your help Luis will be able to continue his college studies.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis Raúl es un joven que tiene todo el deseo de salir adelante actualmente está estudiando los fines de semana y entre semana se dedica a vender ropa de segunda. Todo comenzó en el 2005 que con el afán de no ser una carga más para sus papás quienes no tienen dinero para pagarle sus gastos en la escuela, que Luis comenzó a trabajar con una señora que vende ropa usada y poco a poco se fue independizando hasta formar su propio negocio. “Ya que mi sueño es terminar una carrera profesional y después iniciar mi propia empresa, fue por eso que me decidí a poner este pequeño negocio que me permitirá salir adelante con mis estudios” comentó.

Actualmente Luis no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes es por es oque está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Luis podrá comprar nueva mercancía para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Luis podrá estudiar su carrera universitaria.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana I. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 30 years old, married and has two children.

She and her husband (Her husband is pictured) sell perfumes, and other items in the Beylagan city bazaar. They're requesting a loan in the amount of $1200 to diversify they're inventory.

loans.use: To diversify  the inventory

loans.name: Ma. Esther

texts.es:
For many years Maria Esther was a teacher; once she retired, however, she was unable to support herself with the money that the government paid her. She must also support one of her three daughters, who is studying. What her husband, who is retired as well, earns does not cover household expenses. In 2005 Maria consequently began selling cookies, but she stopped doing it when she had to frequently visit one of her daughters in the United States, who fell ill. During this time, however, a friend told her that she could take advantage of these trips to bring back used clothes and household items to sell because those items sell very well. This is how Maria began her business. She worked with somebody else so that he could watch the business while she went to the United States and spent time with her daughter.

Nevertheless, Maria doesn't have enough merchandise to offer her customers at present. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of $750, which she is ready to repay over a period of 6 months. With this money, Maria will be able to bring back and sell a greater variety of clothes. With your assistance, Maria will be able to help her daughter succeed.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther durante muchos años fue maestra, y desde que se jubiló no podía mantenerse con el dinero que el gobierno le paga. Puesto que de todas sus 3 hijas todavía tiene una hija que apoyar, ya que está estudiando. Y lo que gana su esposo que también es jubilado no les alcanza para pagar los gastos de su casa. En el 2005 María comenzó vendiendo galletas, pero dejó de hacerlo porque una de sus hijas que radica en los Estados Unidos se enfermó y viajaba mucho a verla, fue cuando una amiga le propuso que aprovechara esos viajes para traer pacas de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar usados para vender, ya que eso se vende muy bien, fue así como comenzó y se asoció con otra persona ya que mientras Esther viajaba por la mercancía y estaba unos días con su hija, él se quedaba vendiendo y no se descuidaba el negocio.

Sin embargo Esther actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Esther podrá traer ropa para poder tener más variedad que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Esther podrá sacar a su hija adelante para que termine su carrera.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing in order to have more variety

loans.name: Zinyet

texts.en:
Zinyet A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has three children.

She has a clothing sale business in the Beylagan city bazaar. Her husband (pictured), helps her run the business. She started her business ten years ago. She's requesting a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Shamkhal

texts.en: I. Shamkhal is a 36-year-old trader who owns a small store in the local Imishli bazaar. He is married and has two children. He sells stationeries, clocks and watches. He has four years of experience in this field. He is requesting a loan of $900 so he can purchase more merchandise and expand the variety of goods he sells.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Aqshin

texts.en: Aqshin A. is a 38-year-old trader who sells electronic supplies and small car spare parts in a small village in Imishli region. He is married and has three children. He has five years of experience in selling electronic supplies, but he needs to expand his business so he can meet the growing family expenses as his children get older. He is requesting $1200 to invest in his business and improve the financial conditions of his family.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Khatin

texts.en: Khatin I. is a 51-year-old woman, who owns her small business in the Imishli region. She sells dairy products and breeds calves for meat production. She has seven years of experience in this field. She is married and has four children. Khatin says her one dairy cow and one calf do not generate enough income to care for her family. She is requesting a loan of $1000 so she can purchase 3 calves and fodder and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Serkhan

texts.en: Serhan H. is a 60-year-old farmer who breeds sheep in a small village in Saatli region. He  then sells them to the local bazaar traders for meat production. Mutton is very popular among Azerbaijanis, and people eat mutton almost every day.  He is married and has four children.  Serhan started his business in 1995, when he first purchased two lambs. Now he has a herd of 11 sheep. He is requesting a loan of $1200 so he can purchase 10 more sheep, improve sheep keeping conditions, and improve his earnings.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and upgrade sheep raising conditions

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali H. is a 57-year-old farmer who breeds livestock for meat production in a small village of Saatli region. He has been selling calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders for seven years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 so he can purchase 3 calves and fodder, which will expand his operation and improve his income.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar A. is a 35-year-old trader and businessman who owns his small store in Imishli region. He sells stationary and provides printing/copier service for the local people.  He has seven years of experience in this field. He enjoys his job very much and has a good relationship with clients, so his store is always full of people. Vugar is requesting a loan of $1100 so he can diversify and increase the number of products he sells.

loans.use: To diversify and increase number of products for sale

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
Mrs Martha R. has a coffee shop (known as cafetín in Nicaragua) where she sells coffee, cookies and has recently started to sell soft drinks as well. Her business, which she has had for 3 years, is located at the central market of the city of Leon.

She is married and has 2 sons who study at the university. Martha wants to provide education and all the support they need.

Since she started her business, she has encountered difficult economic situations, but she has always been able to make ends meet. She believes that the credits provided by Ceprodel have been key to her success. So far she has received a total of 15 small credits since she started her activity and she has been able to invest them successfully in her business, constructing the premises of her coffee shop at the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Martha R. es a la venta de café comúnmente llamado cafetín. Tiene su negocio desde hace 3 años en la ciudad de León, en el mercado central en donde también vende galletas y está iniciando las ventas de las gaseosas.

Es madre casada y con dos hijos en la universidad a quienes tiene que brindar educación y apoyo ya que lo necesitan. Desde que inició el negocio, ha atravesado situaciones muy problemáticas ya que a pesar de su difícil situación económica siempre ha logrado salir adelante.

Esto se lo atribuye a los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel desde que inició su actividad hace 3 años, (actualmente 15 créditos) los cuales los ha invertido de manera exitosa en la construcción de su local en el mercado Central de León.

loans.use: To buy more products for her coffee shop

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa L. is a very active and hardworking woman who has always tried to get ahead in life. She has 3 children for whom she has struggled to offer an education. She is married and her husband collaborates with her business endeavors, supporting her in every way. She used to sell cellular phones and $9.99 toys, but she did not generate enough profits. So she decided to start a natural health supplement business which she herself runs, thus avoiding having to pay any employee wages and yielding bigger profits. Her goals are to recruit 12 people in order to train them to promote her products.

They will need to work arduously for a year in order to obtain the best prizes that she will give to her employees as incentives. She hopes to the beautiful house of her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Cristina, es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora ella ha tratado de salir siempre adelante; tiene 3 niños por quien luchar para hacerlos profesionales es casada su esposo es muy colaborador en su actividad porque la apoya en todo.

Anteriormente su negocio era una venta de celulares, y juguetes de 9.99, pero obtenía muy pocas ganancias por lo que decidió cambiar de negocio a una venta de Productos Nutricionales el cual es atendido por ella y así evita pagar sueldos y obtiene mayores ganancias, sus metas son: Lograr reclutar a 12 personas para capacitarlas y puedan promocionar el producto.

Debe trabajar muy fuerte un año para lograr los premios mayores que les dan como incentivo; para poder construir su casa muy bonita como lo ha soñado.

loans.use: Purchase of products to restock her business

loans.name: Derlyn

texts.es:
Derlyn M. sells music CD’s and DVD movies. He has had this business for 10 years; he started his business investing the C$ 1000 he had gotten through a loan buying merchandise. In order to cover his debt, he put a lot of effort in his work and now he has paid the total amount back.

He has a daughter he loves very much and he feels the responsibility to give her a good education.

So far Deryn M. has taken 11 credits with Ceprodel that he has intelligently used to invest in his business, he has bought a V and virgin compact discs. Now he needs to buy more merchandise in order to sell more and improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de música y películas en dvd es el negocio al que se dedica el joven Derlyn M.. Desde hace 10 años decidió invertir C$ 1000 (Un Mil córdobas) en la compra de estos artículos, la inversión la realizó por medio de un préstamo a un prestamista. Para salir de la deuda, comenzó esforzándose grandemente hasta saldarla. Es padre de una hija a la que quiere mucho y está en la responsabilidad de brindarle educación, es necesario destacar que muy inteligentemente, el joven Deryn M. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (11 créditos) que los ha utilizado como inversión en el negocio para la compra de un televisor y adquisición de los discos compactos. Su necesidad es invertir mas en el negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his music and DVD’s business

loans.name: Maria Magda

texts.es:
Mrs Maria Magda lives in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. For 15 years she has been selling shoes in a shop at the central market.

Her story is quite impressive because she started as a street vendor selling “chinelas” (typical sandals) that she would carry around inside a big sack.

This was a very tough job because of the weight she would have to carry around everyday and because she had to work constantly exposed to the sun.

Eventually, she decided to take care of her health and invest in a shop at the central market. She was able to reach her objective through the credits she got from Ceprodel (27 in total) that she invested very wisely.

Nowadays she is very proud of what she has accomplished; nevertheless she knows that she needs to invest on more merchandise as there is a lot of competition in the market. Her wish is to have a large supply of articles and to continue to invest in the infrastructure of her shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Magda es una dama que reside en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Desde hace largos 15 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de zapatos en un local en el mercado Central. Su historia es muy impresionante debido a que comenzó su negocio primeramente vendiendo chinelas ambulantemente en un saco que cargaba todos los días, sin embargo, a pesar de lo dificultoso de este trabajo por el peso y exposición al sol, decide invertir en un local en el mercado de León y así evitarse molestias en su salud. Esto lo realizó gracias a créditos hechos en Ceprodel (27 créditos) que los ha invertido muy sabiamente.

Hoy en día se siente muy contenta por lo que ha logrado, sin embargo cursa una gran necesidad como lo es el invertir en la compra de mercadería ya que no es la única que se dedica al negocio sino que a su alrededor hay varias personas que se dedican a esto y por tal razón atraviesa una fuerte competencia. Su anhelo es surtir mas su negocio y seguir invirtiendo en infraestructura.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and to continue to invest in the infrastructure of her shoe store

loans.name: Natividad Mercedes

texts.es: Natividad Mercedes

loans.use: Purchase of bread and beverages

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sweet handmade bread with corn is later baked in the oven until they are ready to eat. Francisca del Carmen M. is dedicated to her business, selling her baked goods at the Central Markets in the city of León.

She learned to bake since she was a little girl. According to her, her mother taught her - she used to accompany her mother who sold her products along the streets of León. However, her dear mother passed away, leaving her the oven with other belongings. Since then, Francisca started selling baked goods in the streets of León.

For one year and a half, she has been borrowing loans (in total, 8) from Ceprodel. They have been invested in her business to buy corn and used for living costs. Her need for loans lies in the fact that she has no stable place to sell her goods; she is in the open air markets just outside of the Central Markets of León.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Las cosas de horno son panes dulces elaborados con maíz y luego horneados hasta llegar al punto de ser comestibles. A este negocio se dedica la dama francisca del Carmen M., vendiendo sus cosa de horno en el M. Central de la ciudad de León.

Aprendió desde muy pequeña a elaborar estos productos, su mamá le enseñó ya que según cuenta, al ser elaborados, acompañaba a su mamá por las calles de León para vender estos productos. Sin embargo, al fallecer su querida madre le deja como herencia el horno y los enseres por lo que desde ese momento inició a vender las cosa de horno en las calles de León.

Desde hace un año y medio ha realizado Créditos en Ceprodel llegando a un total de 8 créditos que los ha invertido en la compra del maíz y además en algunos gastos del hogar. Su necesidad radica en que no tiene un lugar seguro para realizar sus ventas por lo que se ubica a la intemperie en las afueras del M. Central de León.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Benito Javier

texts.es:
For four years Benito M. has sold movies on DVD. Having established a home and with the added responsibility of looking after a young child, he started this business.

In reality he doesn't have his own store but rather he sells outside on the outskirts of the central market in Leon, where he displays his products.

In spite of his situation he has not lost the dream of improving his quality of life now that he has received loans from Ceprodel that have sufficiently helped him purchase movies and manage his home. He has received 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Benito M. desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de películas en dvd, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de que al haber formado un hogar y con un pequeño a quien mantener tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente no posee un local propio sino que vende a la intemperie en las afueras del mercado central de León , exponiendo sus productos a daños físicos ya que no posee un local seguro. .

A pesar de esta situación no ha perdido las esperanzas de mejorar su nivel de vida ya que ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel que le han ayudado satisfactoriamente en la compra de las películas y en las necesidades de su hogar. (Su record crediticio es de 10 créditos).

loans.use: Purchase of DVD movies

loans.name: Yahaira De Los Ángel

texts.es:
Yahaira de los Ángeles M. dedicates herself to the sale of jewelry such as necklaces, hoop earrings, bracelets, etc. She started this business 8 years ago and she sells her products in the outskirts of the central market in León. Even though she walks around selling, her sales have been very low as she is the mother of 4 children, whom she must take care of with her husband.

The problem for Yahaira is that she doesn't have a set store of her own and she walks around all day exposed to the sun. This makes her very tired and is bad for her health. For one year she has been receiving loans from Ceprodel. They have served her well, as she has acquired new products for her sales and additionally has covered some home expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La actividad a la que se dedica la dama Yahaira de los Ángeles M. es a la venta de productos de bisutería como colas, aretes, pulseras, etc. Inició este negocio desde hace 8 años y los vende en los alrededores del mercado central en León. Afirma que a pesar de vender ambulante las ventas han sido muy bajas por lo que es madre de 4 hijos que junto con su esposo tienen la obligación de mantener.

La problemática por la pasa Yahaira es que como no tiene un local fijo, al andar ambulante se expone al sol y además al cansancio sendo esto perjudicial para su salud. Ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel desde hace 1 año y según afirma, le han servido de mucha utilidad ya que ha adquirido sus productos para la venta y además ha cubierto algunos gastos en su hogar.

loans.use: The sale of artisanry and jewelry

loans.name: Leonarda's Group

texts.en:
Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria have been members of the community bank Arco Iris for 6, 3, and 5 years respectively. In their community bank they have learned to be punctual and responsible, to save, to run their business, to avoid getting sick, and to respect other people.

Leonarda is 36 years old. She is married and has three children, who are 13, 10, and 8. She travels to different markets two times per week and buys grains and cheeses, which she sells at the Grau Market in Ayacucho and also door-to-door. She has had this business for six years.

On the other hand, Petronila is 54 years old. She is a widow and has nine children, only one of whom lives with her. She has been selling groceries from her home for the past three years. Furthermore, Petronila, together with her son, makes weavings. They sell beautiful tapestries and rugs at the Santa Clara market in Ayacucho.

Ana Maria is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, who are 17 and 9. She has a small grocery store which she started six years ago with very little capital but which has continued to grow little by little.

Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria need loans of 1600, 600, and 1000 soles, which they will invest in buying wheat, oatmeal, cornmeal, quinoa, and other local types of flour. They will also buy rice, sugar, beans, cookies, milk, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables.

They plan to use their savings to care for and educate their children, as well as in the case of an emergency. Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria dream of owning their homes, continuing to develop their businesses, and that their children will be able to continue moving up and become professionals.

loans.use: Leonarda, Petronila, and Ana Maria need loans of 1600, 600, and 1000 soles, which they will invest in buying wheat, oatmeal, cornmeal, quinoa and other local types of flour.  They will also buy rice, sugar, beans, cookies, milk, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Pilar

texts.en:
Juana has been part of the community bank Arco Iris for the past 12 years; currently she is the bank president. Juana mentioned that in her bank she has learned to be responsible, punctual and respectful, how to save, and how to educate her children. With her savings Juana has been able to educate her children, buy a piece of land, and improve her house.

Juana is 48 years old. She is married and has six children, the youngest of whom is six years old. She lives in the small town of Rancha. Juana travels to different markets in the region where she buys grains, cheeses, animals, and other products which she later sells in the Playa Grau market in Ayacucho. Furthermore, Juana, together with her husband, raises cattle.

Juana needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying corn, peas, wheat, quiN., cheese, roosters, guinea pigs, and pork.

Juana dreams of buying more land, building a house closer to the road, providing an education for her children, and having a bigger business.

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying corn, peas, wheat, quinoa, cheese, roosters, guinea pigs, and pork.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
I have been selling new and used clothing for over 10 years. This business is my family’s sole source of income, since my elderly parents are under my care. I would like to invest in my business by purchasing new apparel and making improvements on my business space without losing profits. I am requesting a loan for $1,200.00 USD to buy more merchandise and improve my business space. 
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
Tengo ya más de 10 años con el negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que tengo a mi cargo a mis padres que son unas personas ya grandes de edad. Y quiero invertirle mas al negocio sin descapitalizarme comprar ropa nueva y acondicionar mejor el local. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para acondicionar mejor el negocio y comprar mas mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and improvement of business space

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es:
Mr. Candelario I. has been selling groceries for over 5 years. “My wife and I work in our mini market, which is very important for us as it is our family’s sole source of income. We would like to invest in it more without losing profits. We are requesting a loan of $1,000.00 USD in order to buy more goods.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Candelario tiene ya más de 5 años con su negocio de venta de abarrotes. En el negocio trabajamos mi esposa y yo, el negocio es muy importante para nosotros ya que es la fuente de ingreso de nuestra familia. Queremos invertirle más sin descapitalizarnos. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. para la comprar de mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
I have been making plaster sculptures for a living for over five years. This is my family’s source of income. My brother and I work in the business, and we would like to invest in it more without losing profits. We want to buy more material and pottery molds to make a greater variety of figurines. We are requesting a loan of $500.00 USD to buy the materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 5 años que me dedico a la elaboración de figuras de yeso. Este negocio es le fuente de ingresos de mi familia, en el negocio trabajamos mi hermano y yo queremos invertirle mas al negocio sin descapitalizarnos. Queremos comprar más materia prima y moldes para ser más diferentes figuras. Solicitamos un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls para la compra de materia prima.

loans.use: Purchse of materials for his business

loans.name: Thi Thanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thạnh, 30 years old, has 2 school age children. She sells seasonal fruits. Because the market is not too far from her house she has more time to help her husband, a carpenter, at his shop. Usually she runs out of fruits before noon. That’s why she wish to have more capital to buy fruits so she can stay at the market longer and earns extra income for her family. She prefers to take out loan from Binh Minh because it allows her to pay in, though weekly, small installments.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Thạnh, 30 tuổi, có 2 con còn đang đi học. Chị đi chợ bán hoa quả, mùa nào thứ đấy chứ chị không chuyên bán theo loại quả nào. Từ nhà chị ra chợ cũng khá gần nên chị có thời gian để phụ giúp chồng. Chồng chị làm nghề mộc ở nhà đã được vài năm nay. Thường thì chị chỉ bán buổi sáng là đã hết sạch hàng, vì vậy chị muốn vay vốn để mua thêm hàng bán, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị rất thích vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh minh vì với những người đi chợ như chị, trả góp sẽ dễ dàng hơn.

loans.use: Buy fruits at wholesale

loans.name: Thi Tam

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tâm, 38 years of age, has 2 children: one boy and one girl. They are both at school age. She sells chè, variety of Vietnamese sweet deserts made from different kinds of bean and sugar. She’s been doing this for many years now. Because her house is situated right at the central part of Chờ township, her chè stand is very popular. Its customers are in all walks of life, from level 3 students to government workers. Her husband is not well so she has to take care the household by herself.
