Everyday she gets up early to cook chè, then prepares feed for pigs. She gets few pigs for extra income. She would like to apply for a loan at Binh Minh to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tâm, 39 tuổi, có 2 con, 1 trai, 1 gái vẫn còn đang đi học. Chị bán hàng chè (được nấu bằng các loại đỗ và đường...) từ nhiều năm nay. Nhà chị ở trung tâm ở thị trấn Chờ nên chị bán hàng khá đông khách. Khách hàng của chị rất phong phú từ các em học sinh cấp III đến công chức, người dân..., đều có. Chồng chị không được khỏe lắm nên mọi việc đều do chị thu vén và sắp xếp. Hàng ngày, chị phải dậy sớm để nấu chè và nấu cám cho lợn ăn. Nhà chị có chăn nuôi thêm đàn lợn để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị mong muốn vay vốn ở Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Bình minh cdc vì theo chị, nó chia nhỏ khỏan nợ và chị có thể dễ dàng trả được nợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok S., 35, is married with two children. He works as a motor-taxi driver and is employed part-time as a security guard earning on average around $4 each day in revenue. His wife is lately employed by a garment factory earning typically about $3.20 per day. To raise his income, Mr. Sok S. would like to build rental rooms partly onto his house, to rent to the people in his area, but he is faced with a financial constraint. To build the rental rooms, he has applied for a loan amount of $1000 from Credit MFI.

loans.use: To build rental rooms partly onto his house to rent to the people in his area.

loans.name: Thi Dong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đông is an active and capable woman. She has two sons who are married and a daughter who is still in school. She own the biggest rice store in her township. The shop offers both wholesale and retail to customers that why she needs stock clerks. Her husband runs a mechanical shop next to hers. She was named young entrepreneur of the township. She would like to take out loan from Binh Minh to expand her business to near by townships.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Đông là một phụ nữ khá năng động và giỏi tính toán trong làm ăn. Cô có hai con trai đều đã lấy vợ và một cô con gái còn đang đi học. Hiện cô là một trong những chủ cửa hàng bán gạo lớn nhất tại thị trấn. Cô vừa bán buôn, vừa bán lẻ vì vậy cô phải thuê thêm nhân công chuyên bốc dỡ và trông hàng. Chồng cô thì mở cửa hàng cơ khí ngay cạnh. Cô còn là thành viên tích cực của câu lạc bộ doanh nhân trẻ của thị trấn. Cô thích vay vốn của chương trình tài chinh vi mô Binh minh cdc vì hy vọng có thể nhân rộng mô hình kinh doanh sang các huyện khác.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But V., 19, is married and has one small child. She and her husband, aged 22, work making mortar and pestle and collectively earn about $7 each day in revenue. There are four members in her family, including her mother, living with her. Mrs. But V. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rocks to enable her to increase the number of her products to meet her clients’ needs. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Buth V. is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase more rock to enable her to increase the number of her mortar and pestles to sell.

loans.name: Thi Nhan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nhàn lives in Nghiêm Xá village of Chờ towship, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh province. She runs a food stand where she serves rice dishes. Beside that she uses leftover from her food stand as feed for her stock of 20 pigs. Normally, she keeps pigs for 3 months then sells them for nice profit. She would like to borrow money to upgrade the food stand and be able to serve more variety of dishes. Everyday income can be used for repayments. Before, she took out loan from a bank and had to pay in lump sum. Now, at Binh Minh, she just needs to pay small installments that she prefers.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nhàn trú tại thôn Nghiêm Xá, Thị trấn Chờ, huyện Yên Phong, tỉnh Bắc Ninh từ nhiều năm nay. Nghề chính của chị là bán hàng cơm cũng đã được 10 năm. Bên cạnh đó, vợ chồng chị còn tận dụng thức ăn thừa để nuôi 20 con lợn, sau 3 tháng bán đi, chị thu được khoản lãi đáng kể. Vay vốn đợt này, chị mong muốn có tiền để hỗ trợ cho công việc kinh doanh của mình như nâng cấp cửa hàng, đa dạng hoá món ăn... Bán hàng hàng ngày chị có thể tiết kiệm để trả dần. Trước kia, chị đã tham gia vay vốn ở Ngân hàng nhưng bây giờ chị thích tham gia vay vốn trả dần hơn. Vì theo chị, nó giúp chị tiết kiệm tốt hơn và chị có điều kiện để nuôi các cháu ăn học

loans.use: Upgrade a food stand

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S., 63, is widow and has seven children. She works very hard on her plot of land growing variety of vegetables and she then sell them to the people in her community. She normally makes on average around $4.60 each day, while three of her children are lately employed at Thailand as laborers and the rest of whom are enrolled in school.  Kim S. has had a problem with a water system to grow her crop. Additionally, she will use this loan to purchase a water- pump machine and pipes to enable her to get water supply from a nearby pond and a well in her community. This will enable her to make the cultivation much further faster, easier and more effective. ( Her husband is pictured with one of her daugher because Kim S. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump machine and pipes to facilitate her water supplies.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S., 63, is widow and has seven children. She works very hard on her plot of land growing variety of vegetables and she then sell them to the people in her community. She normally makes on average around $4.60 each day, while three of her children are lately employed at Thailand as laborers and the rest of whom are enrolled in school.  Kim S. has had a problem with a water system to grow her crop. Additionally, she will use this loan to purchase a water- pump machine and pipes to enable her to get water supply from a nearby pond and a well in her community. This will enable her to make the cultivation much further faster, easier and more effective.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump machine and pipes to facilitate her water supplies.

loans.name: Thi Quy

texts.vi:
Mrs Quý is 43 years old. She has 3 children who are all grown up and married. Everyday, she goes to the market to sell pork and she raises a drift of sows at home. Her husband wakes up very early to go pick up the pork from the supplier for her. Beside selling pork, they also sell bean curd that they buy from the neighbors. Previously, she had contracted out loans from "Ngân hàng nông nghiệp và Phát triển Nông thôn" (Bank of Agriculture and Farming) but she found the paperwork to be too complicated. This time she applies to SEDA for a loan to buy mash for her drift of sows

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Quý, 43 tuổi, có 3 con đều đã xây dựng gia đình. Hàng ngày cô đi chợ bán thịt lợn, ở nhà cô chăn nuôi đàn lợn nái. Chồng cô thì sáng sớm đi lấy hàng về cho cô bán. Ngoài ra, gia đình cô còn buôn bán đỗ tương cho những hộ làm đậu quanh vùng. Nhà cô làm khá nhiều nghề nên trước kia cô vay vốn của Ngân hàng nông nghiệp và Phát triển Nông thôn Huyện Yên Phong, tuy nhiên cô cũng thích vay của chương trình tài chính vi mô vì không phải làm những thủ tục rườm rà. Cô vay vốn để mua thêm cám chăn nuôi.

loans.use: To buy pig mash

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun L., 29, is a mother of two school-aged children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her plot of land growing yams and raising pigs, earning on average around $5 each day. Her husband operates a motor-taxi business and typically earns about $8 each day in revenue. Mrs. Oun L. has applied for a loan to purchase a mini truck to enable her to carry a large quantity of her yams to sell in her community. This will raise her income.

loans.use: To purchase a mini truck to enable her to carry a larger quantity of her yams to sell.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Mrs. A. NA. (57), and her husband have been married since 1970. They have three children — one son and two daughters. Two of their children are in full time employment and the youngest one is studying A. a local school. NA. and her family live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She runs a grocery store A. her home and has been selling cotton scarves since 2000. Her husband assists her in this business.

NA. is requesting her second loan for $1200. She will use this loan to expand her grocery store and scarf business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and scarves for reselling

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en: I am Ishrat B., wife of Hadi Muhammad.  I have three children, one of my sons is in kindergarten while the others are young. My husband constructs buildings on contract. My husband requests a loan to obtain a big order and buy a few required tools. I therefore, request a loan in a group. Jameela B. requests a loan to buy a cow .Voilet B. requests a loan for the expansion of their video games club. Zeenat B. requests this loan for goats trading.

loans.use: To buy a few required tools

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Yeat (42), and her husband, Mr. Pich Touch have been married since 1990. They have four children — two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are studying at a local school; their oldest son is helping them with their farming business and the youngest one stays at home.  Yeat and her family live on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She and husband are in the business of doing farming, raising cows and running horse carts since 1985. After borrowing money again and again to expand their business, they are now in the position to save money to build their new house (shown in the photo).

Yeat is requesting her seventh loan for $1000. She will use this loan to add to her own money to build the house.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mrs. Ven C., 49, works selling a variety of grocery products to people in her area, and generally makes about $3.60 each day. Her husband is a village chef and also helps her sell when he is available. Mrs.Ven C. has five children. Two of them are employed at a garment factory, each earning $2.40 a day, and the rest are unemployed. Lately she has applied for a loan to enable her to purchase more grocery products to meet growing customer demand. The rest of the loan she will use to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation. She and her family are appreciative of the loan to her family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet growing customer demand.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sopheap and her husband, Mr. Kong Sambath have been married since 1979. They have six children — four sons and two daughters. Two of their sons are construction workers, another is helping his mother spin thread, and the youngest is studying in local school. Both of her daughters weave silk at home. Sopheap started her silk production in 1980. She has three looms including her children’s looms for running her business. Besides silk production, she also grows rice. Her husband builds houses. Sopheap and her family live across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sopheap has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is requesting another loan for $1000. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Chek (47) and her husband, Tuy Sun have been married since 1988. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. All of their children are studying in a local school. Chek and her family live along national road number one, south of Phnom Penh. She has been in business selling bananas and flowers since 2000. She buys them from farms in her village for reselling at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband does farming and grows flower on his farm far from home. 

Chek is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA for $1000. She will use this loan to expand her business and to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To buy bananas for reselling and to make house repairs

loans.name: Shama's Group

texts.en: I live in a small lush green town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. My husband is a day laborer and I work in the agricultural fields. I am obtaining loan in my group for the fifth time and have always repaid loans without any delays. This time I will use the loan to buy cattle.  I am a mother of five: one of whom attends school, the other is a tailor and three are young. I have a group and all its members are very cooperative and help each other in time of need. Nasreen A., she requests a loan to buy a cow and goat. Nasreen Y. requests this loan for her husband’s auto lubricants shop. Rozelene B. will give this loan to her husband for his construction business, and Samina B. requests this loan for her husband to buy few of the construction supplies.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk K. N., 51, works with her husband selling dried yams to the people in her community. They generally earn around $5 each day in revenue. She has four children. Three of them are presently employed at a nearby garment factory and another one is a student. Mrs. Uk K. N. hopes to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of yams from the growers, because of growing  customer demand. The rest of the loan will be used to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to meet her client's needs.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
I have lived all my life in a small town Kot Radha Kishan, which is about 50 kilometers away from a big city Lahore.  I have six children, three of whom are enrolled in a local school.  My husband is a constructor and lays concrete roof tops while I work at a local factory. I request a loan to buy goats which one of my sons raise at home to trade. 
Nasreen S. requests a loan for her husband’s construction business. Sheela S. will buy a cow with the loan. Root S. requests the loan to buy an embroidery machine. Sumaira B. will also buy a cow with this loan.   
I am the group leader of these women for past four years. All of them are my friends and I love being their leader because this gives me an opportunity to do something that can bring positive changes in their lives.

loans.use: To buy a few required tools

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en: Mukaddas R. lives in Spitamen and is married with 2 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 when she was in a difficult situation and applied for a loan. She started her business practically from scratch and is now engaged in the furniture rental business renting plastic tables and stools for wedding receptions.  Mrs. R. is very experienced in her business (about 10 years).  She is now requesting a loan of $850 for the purchsae of new plastic tables and stools.

loans.use: for the purchase of new tables and stools

loans.name: Srean

texts.en: Mrs. SrE.  E., 32, is married and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works with her husband buying fish from fishermen and reselling them for a profit, making around $7.50/day in revenue. The couple would like to use this loan to reinvest in her business and enable them to purchase fishing tools to fish themselves.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her fishery business.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
A. Marhabo is 33 years old. She is married and has two children.

She was been selling clothes for women for  8 years in the local market of Istaravshan city. Her husband used to help her in the business, but he recently had to leave for Russia for a job. Twice a month Marhabo goes to purchase new goods to sell. Thus she is trying to have the new goods in order to keep up with the demand of her clients. Her business is the only source of income for her family. So, Marhabo is working hard to generate efficient profits to ensure that she can support her family.  

Marhabo has been provided with loans by IMON for 2 years. For the entire period of time she has shown herself as an accurate client having a positive credit history. Today Marhabo requests 1000.00 US Dollars. Part of the loan she is planning to spend to purchase  new clothing for women to sell and the rest to pay the rent for the trading place in the market. Marhabo thanks everyone for support and promises to pay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women to sell and pay the rent for the trading place

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: My name is Shazia S.. I have very good members in my loan group and we are responsible for each other's loans. I have two daughters who are not of school age yet. I am acquiring credit for the third time from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. My husband has a construction business and I perform my household chores and take care of my kids. I request a loan for my brother who makes light arrangements on weddings and other various occasions. I would like to borrow in a group with a few women.They are: Naseem B., who needs a loan to buy cattle; Nusrat B., who will use this loan to expand their sanitary store and buy items such as taps, pipes etc.; Jameela B., who will use this loan for their construction business; and Rafia B., who requests this loan for her husband who is a constructor. I believe we all will be able to pay off your loans on time.

loans.use: To expand current business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
A. Mavjuda is 33 years old. She is the loving mother of three children. Mavjuda has been divorced since 1999 and for all this time she has been supporting her family alone. Her parents are trying to help her, however, Mavjuda never asked her parents to assist her financially.  

For  the past 4 years Mavjuda has been selling clothing for women and kids in one of the local markets. Two times in a month she travels to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan to purchase new goods. For the time of her trip her parents are looking after the kids. Mavjuda tries to have so wide range of goods in order to meet the requirements of clients with various tastes and incomes . 

Today Mavjuda requires 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars). This is her first loan; however, she is sure that she shall pay the loan in 12 months. Mavjuda is planning to purchase the new clothing for women to expand her business; so that she can have the money for her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women to sell so she can have the money for her children's education

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Mrs. Hol K., 54, is a widow and has nine children. Four of them are enrolled in school, and the rest are married and live separately. Mrs. Hol K. works making Khmer traditional cakes and reselling them in her area. She makes about $7.50 each day in revenue. She would like to sell not only Khmer cakes but also a variety of grocery products, which would enable her to raise her income. Unfortunately she faces a financial constraint. Thus, Mrs. Hol K. has requested a loan to help her operate a grocery business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.en: Mashkhura M. lives in Spitamen and she is married with 3 children. She started her business selling small wares but now has her own store trading socks, fibers, mirrors, clothespin and the every day small wares. She is experienced in  her business (about 10 years) and has great ideas on how she would like to develop her business that she would like to implement. She is now requesting a loan to import new goods.

loans.use: to import new goods

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
S. Nodira is 29 years old. She is married. Her husband is unemployed, but he is helping his wife. Nodira does not have yet the kids. However, she and her husband are supporting Nodira’s mother-in-law and sister-in-law.

Nodira is selling foodstuffs like macaroni, noodles, rice, oil, etc. in one of the local markets. Having been in this business for several years, Nodira knows how to run it properly. The business is stable and generates the significant income for the family.

Nodira has been a client of IMON for 7 years already. She is an accurate client having the positive history without any delinquency or violations. Today Nodira requests 1000.00 US Dollars for purchasing the foodstuff in order to enlarge the range of goods she is able to sell. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of the goods to increase product selection

loans.name: Oibeck

texts.en: Oibeck T. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006.  He is a cook and supplements his earnings by raising and selling livestock.  It is the family business started by his ancestors. He is requesting a loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: for purchasing a cow

loans.name: Sarhami

texts.en: Sarhami, 45, is a mother of 2 children aged 17 and 9. Her husband, A., sells waste materials and earns USD10.5 a week. To support her husband's income she sell detergents door-to-door around the villages, earning USD4 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Apiah

texts.en: Apiah, 45, is a mother of 3 children. Her husband, A., sells tofu and earns USD10.5 a week. To help her husband, she has opened a food booth at her house where she sells snacks, candies, beverages, etc., earning USD5 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah, 40, sells vegetables door-to-door around the villages, earning USD2 a day. Her husband, S., works as a landless farmer and earns a very small income. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to expand her vegetable business, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 27, sells snacks, beverages, etc., at her house, earning USD10.5, while her husband, O., is no longer working. She is requesting a loan of USD125 to fill her shop with more inventory and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Ubed

texts.en: Ubed, 43, sells flavoured ice, earning USD4 a day, while her husband, S., does not have a fixed job. She is asking for a loan of USD150 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sartinah

texts.en: Sartinah, 36, raises ducks at her house, and then sells their eggs to the market, earning USD16. Her husband, S., sells kerosene door-to-door and earns USD26 a week.  She is requesting a loan of USD150 to buy more ducks to raise. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Huneng

texts.en: Huneng, 30, has a small booth at her house where she sells snacks, beverages, vegetables, etc., earning USD5 a day. Her husband, A., does not work anymore so she has to provide for her family's needs by herself. She is asking for a loan of USD125 to fill her booth with more goods. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her booth with more goods

loans.name: Nawiyah

texts.en: Nawiyah, 32, has a small shop where she sells food, household goods, beverages, etc., at her house. She earns USD10. She opened this shop to earn income for the family because her husband, N., does not work anymore. She is requesting a loan of USD175 to add to her business capital, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Awisih

texts.en: Awisih is a 45 year old woman whose husband, A., does not work anymore, so she has to earn income for the family by herself. Everyday she sells rice, earning USD10 a day. She is requesting a loan of USD100 to expand her business. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mini

texts.en: Mini, 22, has a food stall at her house, where she sells snacks, earning USD3 a day. Her husband, U., sells steel and earns USD6 a day. She is requesting a loan of USD100 to fill her stall with more goods, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her stall with more goods

loans.name: Nurhaya

texts.en: Nurhaya, 37, has a small stall at her house, where she sells snacks, beverages, vegetables, etc., earning USD10 a day with a small profit. Her husband, N., sells baskets and earns USD20 a day. She is requesting a loan of USD125 to expand her business, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tutun

texts.en: Tutun S. is a 25 year old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, leaving her to work by herself to provide for her family's needs. She opened a small food stall where she sells snacks, beverages, etc., earning USD20 a week. She is asking for a loan of USD125 to fill her stall with more goods, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her stall with more goods

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti, 22, has a waste materials business, earning USD5 a day, while her husband, Kosasih, does not work anymore. The family depends on Siti's business. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of USD100 to expand her business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bahtiyer

texts.en: Bahtiyer I. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children.  I. Bahtiyer heard a lot about MicroInvest and decided to apply to MicroInvest for a business development loan. It improved his business and he opened business making wood windows frames and doors. He has the appropriate knowledge and has been working as the carpenter for the last 10 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: for purchasing wood

loans.name: Wasswa Iii Group

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with five children. She has a market stall where she sells raw food. She intends to pay school fees for the children with the extra profits earned from this loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and expand her market business

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en: Hamidah, 41, and her husband, B., are rice farmers. They sell the rice to the market. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of USD75 to expand the business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sainah

texts.en: Sainah, 35, sells eggs door-to-door around the villages to earn extra income for the family, earning USD15 a day. Her husband, M., sells steel and earns USD53 in two weeks. She is requesting a loan of USD125 to add to her business capital, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Ami

texts.en: Ami, a 48 year old widow, has been selling vegetables at her house since her husband passed away a long time ago. She has to work by herself to provide for her family's needs, earning USD5 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to add to her business capital, and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Ernah

texts.en: Ernah, 30, is mother of a 10-year-old child. She has goat livestock, earning USD 30 in 3 months. Her husband, M., does not work anymore, so now she is the only one who works in the family. She requests a loan of USD75 to expand her business and as a member of MBK agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Saryamah

texts.en: Saryamah, 32, is a mother of 3 children aged 16, 15 and 9. Her husband, J., does not work anymore. To support her family she sells instant noodles at her house, earning USD3 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to add her business capital and as a member of MBK is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Adding her business capital

loans.name: Yanah

texts.en: Yanah, 32, is mother of 3 children. Her husband, A., works as an employee who earns USD95 a month. She sells cloth door-to-door around the village to get extra income, earning USD20 a week. She requests a loan of USD75 to add her business capital and as a member of MBK agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To add to business capital

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini, 37, is a mother of 4 children. Her husband, M., sells chickens and earns USD60 a month. She raises goat to earn extra income for the family and earns USD30 in 3 months. She requests a loan of USD75 to expand her business and as a member of MBK agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Hasti

texts.en: Hasti, 30, is a mother of 3 children. Her husband, H., sells waste materials and earns a very small income. So she has a small shop where she sells crispy chips, vegetable oil, etc., and earns USD10 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to fill her shop with more goods and as a member of MBK is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more goods

loans.name: Icah

texts.en: Icah, 42, is a mother of 5 children. Her husband, M., is in the waste materials business and earns USD10 a day. So to get some extra income she sells clothes on credit door-to-door, earning USD20 a week. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to expand her business and as a member of MBK is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.en: Khurshida T. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2007 as soon as she heard from colleagues about the loan terms of MicroInvest. She runs a livestock business and also sells household goods. She is experienced in business (about 6 years) and has different ideas on growing her business. She wants to purchase a cow to sell milk products and is therefore requesting a loan.

loans.use: for purchasing a cow

loans.name: Tabu's Faidilea Group

texts.en:
Tabu is 47 years old. She is married and has three grown children. She and her husband also take care of three other children, ages 15, 11, and 6. Tabu is a food vendor and sells dishes and snacks between 6am and 8pm daily. She started this business in 1997 and now she makes a monthly profit of about $170.

Tabu hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items in order to increase her sales. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have businesses dealing in clothing and food sales.

loans.use: to buy food items

loans.name: Iis

texts.en: Iis, 20, is a mother of one child.  Her husband, E., has no fixed job. To help her husband earn income she sells snacks, household goods, etc. at her small store, and earns USD15 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to buy more goods for her store and as a member of MBK is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Emboy

texts.en: Emboy, 25, is a mother of 2 children. Her husband, M., sells steel and earns USD3 a day. To help her husband provide income for the family, she sells fruits and beverages at her food stall and earns USD3 a day. She requests a loan of USD75 to expand her business and, as a member of MBK, agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kyobe I(A) Group

texts.en:
Teo is married with four children. She has a public pay phone, sells airtime cards and also offers phone charging services. She wants to pay school fees for the children and buy a piece of land with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase another pay phone and more air time cards

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en: Asiah, 37, sells food, beverages, vegetables at her small shop, earning USD15 a day to provide income for the family.  Her husband, M., is unemployed. She requests a loan of USD175 to fill her shop with more inventory and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within 12 months

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Simah

texts.en: Simah, 47, has a vegetables stall at her house. She can earn up to USD 10 a day, while her husband, P., is a driver who earns about USD60 a month. She is asking for a loan of USD150 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Rohamah

texts.en: Rohamah, 47, sells snacks, candies, rice, etc. at her small shop, earning USD15 a day to provide for her family's needs.  Her husband, T., does not work anymore. She is asking for a loan of USD150 to fill her shop with more inventory and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is 45 years old. She is divorced and has two grown children, ages 30 and 31. She also takes care of a 12 year old grandchild. Shida owns a clothing business, which she started in 2005. She works daily from 7am to 4pm.

Shida hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothing to sell. She is a member of a loan group called Stone which has 25 members.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Kyobe I(B) Group

texts.en:
Justine is 30 years old. She owns a public pay phone. She intends to begin a piggery business and to renovate her rental houses with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more airtime cards.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en: Azimjon I. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children.  He has a MicroInvest client since 2006 because he heard many successful stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan circle.  He started his business selling small ware selling but now he has improved his business markedly permitting him to open his own shop selling food products.  He has a wide-side assortment (the meat products, the milk-sour products, flour products and oil) that he purchases straight from suppliers.  Now he is requesting a loan for business development and the purchasing of noodles.

loans.use: for business development and purchasing ingredients

loans.name: Central A (I) Group

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and married with three children. She is a poultry farmer. She wants to use the extra profits to construct another poultry house, purchase more chicks and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Central A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Aisha is married with three chidren. She is a diary farmer. She supplies milk to a small restaurant near her home. She wants to buy more fresian cows with the extra profits and also pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more milk cans and buy a fridge.

loans.name: Central A (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Prossy is a livestock farmer. She rears cows, goats and sheep on a small scale. She wants to use the extra profits to construct a kraal and buy a water tank.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.en: Rahbar K. lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She became the client of the MicroInvest in 2003 when she was in a difficult situation and applied for a loan. She started the business practically from scratch and now she has her own trade outlet selling childres wears. Procuring directly from suppliers her prices are lower than bazaar prices and she has many repeat customers. She is now requesting a loan to purchase new goods.

loans.use: for purchasing new goods

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (A) Group

texts.en:
Teddy is 35 years old and married with five children. She has a market stall where she sells raw foodstuffs - mainly matooke (banana food). With the extra profits, she intends to renovate her rental houses and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke from the villages.

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (B) Group

texts.en:
Phiona (group leader) is married with four children. She has a public pay phone. Sarah has a saloon. Faridah sells charcoal. Silvia sells raw food in the market. Mariam sells furniture. The group has been together for one year. With the extra profits, Phiona wants to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase another pay phone

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Jesca (group leader) is 32 years old and divorced with 3 children. She sells furniture for a living. Harriet works in a hotel, Aisha has a market stall, Sarah is a hairdresser and Madina is a tailor. Jesca wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en: Sobir A. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 4 children. He has been a MicroInvest client since 2003 because he heard so many uccessful stories from his friends on the MicroInvest loan circle. He started selling food products and has a wide-side assortment of goods and repeat customers because his prices are lower than the bazaar's prices. He has a different assortment of goods: milk-sour products (pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd), meat products (sausages, salami, boiled sausages and the black pudding), vegetable oil, flour products and sweets. He is now requesting a loan to begin selling perfumes.

loans.use: to expand and add a new business line

loans.name: Thi Kieu Anh Ha

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hà, 23 years old, is married and has one child. The husband and wife tend a shoe shop at home. The shop caries footwear which targets young customers. Two year ago, prior to the shoe shop she had a music store. The reason for her to change was there are fewer shoe stores in town. She invests quite a bit and had to borrow 10 millions VND (~625USD) from her relatives. She would like to take out a loan from Binh Minh because it allows her to pay in small installments. Her daily income is about 100,000VND (~6.25USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hà, 23 tuổi, đã có chồng và một con nhỏ. Hai vợ chồng chị mở cửa hàng bán giầy dép tại nhà. Cửa hàng của chị khá nhiều mẫu mã, chủ yếu là phục vụ giới trẻ. Trước kia chị mở cửa hàng bán băng đĩa nhưng mới chuyển sang mặt hàng này được 2 năm vì tại thị trấn rất ít cửa hàng bán. Chị đầu tư vốn khá nhiều và phải vay mượn bà con họ hàng hơn 10 triệu đồng. Chị thích vay vốn theo Chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh minh vì chị được trả góp dần hàng tuần, chị đầu tư mua thêm một số mẫu dép mới. Mỗi ngày thu nhập gia đình chị từ bán hàng cũng lãi gần 100.000đ nên chị thấy việc trả theo tuần khá hợp lý.

loans.use: Buy footwear

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (D) Group

texts.en:
Prossy (group leader) is 33 years old and divorced with four children. She has a retail shop. The group has been together for ten months. Joyce sells used clothes, Christine sells shoes and Sarah sells new clothes. Prossy wants to use the extra business profits to pay shcool fees for the children and begin a poultry business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more goods or products for her shop.

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (E) Group

texts.en:
Brenda is married with 12 children. She is a tailorress. The group has been together for one year and all have different businesses. Hellen has a retail shop; Robina runs a saloon; Malusi sells charcoal; Rosette sells foodstuffs. Brenda intends to buy a piece of land with the extra business profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: New Kabale I (A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Jesca (group leader) is a 48 year old widow with 14 children. She has a taxi business. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children and start up a poultry business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To take her taxi to the garage for servicing.

loans.name: New Kabale I (B) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for 11 months. Alice is 49 years old and marreid with three children. Her current business is livestock farming. She has two cows and four goats on zero grazing. Alice wants to start up a cultivation business with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en: Maruf A. lives in Spitamen and is married with 2 children. He has been the client of the MicroInvest since 2007 and they recommend him as a reliable client. Mr.A. is experienced and engaged in the sale of building materials. Now he would like to open a store to sell iron/metallic fabrics and is requesting a loan in order to be able to do so.

loans.use: to open a store

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en: I live in Riawind with my husband and children. I have been in this city for past twenty years. My husband makes and sells shoes; my elder son is a local transport driver and the younger drives a rickshaw. This would be my second loan from Asasah, the microfinance institution. Last year we used this loan for our shoes business and this year we request an additional loan for the same. We plan to offer socks along with shoes. My group members also request loans.  Zainab S. requests this loan to expand her beauty parlor. Khursheed B. will invest in their business . Inayat B. will invest this loan in their shoes business. Shamim M. makes embroidered clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To expand shoes manufacturing business

loans.name: New Kabale I (C) Group

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and married with five children. She sells furniture to earn a living. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kabowa 1(A) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for one year. Each memeber has their own current businesses and reasons for acquiring loans. Florence has a poultry farm; Dorothy has a saloon business; Sumaya sells raw foods; Fiona sells crafts. Harriet, the group leader, is 40 years old. She sells raw foods in the market. She intends to use the extra profits to construct a house and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more raw foods, thus expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kabowa 1(B) Group

texts.en:
Margret sells charcoal in the market. She wants to use the extra business profits to construct a house (storage) for the charcoal, and also to pay school fees for the children. Sylvia is a tailor and wants to use the loan to buy more thread and a new sewing machine. Goret wants to use the loan to pay rent for her salon. Aisha wants to purchase more firewood with the aquired loan, and Regina intends to purchase more hides and skins.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To enlarge the business by stocking more charcoal

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kabowa 1(C) Group

texts.en:
Amina (group leader) is 31 years old and married with three children. She runs a small restaurant. She wants to pay school fees for the children with the extra business profits. Prossy wants to buy poultry feed with the loan. Molly intends to purchase more matooke, while Farida wants to purchase more shoes to sell with the new loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and food warmers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary E. is married with 10 children. She is 61 years old. She makes beads and hair decorations. She is the leader of her union. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy bead materials, weavon (hair product) and clothes for sale. She learned the trade for 2 years and has been in it since 1987.

loans.use: To buy more material for beads and clothes for sale

loans.name: Kabowa 2(A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Zaituni is 38 years old, married and has seven children. She runs a small canteen, and wants to use the extra profits made possible by the loan to pay her rent and school fees for her children. Jane has a retail shop and will use the loan to buy more goods to sell to her customers. Zaria wants to buy more raw food to sell. Irene wants to use the loan to buy poultry, and Nulu will use it to add to the stock available for sale in her boutique.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To enlarge several businesses by buying additional items to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose E. is a Bini by tribe from Edo state, Nigeria. She sells yams at market. She is 51 years old, married with 8 children. She is a LAPO member and she needs the loan of $450 to buy more yams for sale. She learned this business for 12 months and started her business 1998.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with three children and she is 31 years old. She is into sales of drinks and foodstuffs. She is a LAPO member from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She learned the business for 3 years and started her business in 2002.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. trades in clothes. She is 48 years old and married with 8 children. She has been a LAPO member for 4 years. She asks for the loan amount of $450 in order to buy more clothes to sell. She learned her business for three months and started in 2005.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Kabowa 1(D) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for nine months. Catherine is married and has three children. She earns a living by selling timber, and would like to expand her business by buying more material to sell to her customers. With the extra income she earns from increased sales, she intends to pay her rent and buy a saw. Ruth has a poultry business and wants to use the loan to buy chickenfeed. Aida intends to buy a juice blender. Aidah wants to use the loan to buy a hair dryer, and Carol would like to buy food warmers for her small food stand.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying more equipment or materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kabowa 1(E) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for 12 months. Betty is married with seven children, and runs a poultry farm. She needs to buy more baby chicks to raise, and intends to use the money she makes from selling them when they are grown to build a new chicken house and buy a piece of land. Mary and Annet work as seamstresses and plan to use their portions of the loan to buy new sewing machines. Prossy plans to set up her own kiosk in the local market and Zaina wants buy a hair dryer for her beauty salon. Each member of this group is confident that these steps will increase their income and help them and their families live better lives.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying new equipment or materials

loans.name: Mtumwa's Clothes Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 22 years old. She is married and has a four year old child. She has a clothing business which she started in 2002. Everyday, she sells clothing from 7am to noon. In a month, she can make a profit of about $165.

Mtumwa hopes for a loan to increase her supply of clothing. She will share this loan with Zuhura, a member in her loan group who also sells clothing in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Ann Osaghae

texts.en: Ann is a woman of 54 years old is married with five children. She sells akara (bean cake). She is from Edo state and also a LAPO member. She needs the loan amount of $200 to enable her buy more bags of beans and gallons of oil for her trade. She learned business for 4 months and started it in 2002.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and gallons of oil

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin L. H., 38, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her piece of land growing a variety of vegetables and reselling them at an open-air market, making on average $2 each day of profit. Her husband can typically make $2 each day from working as a motor-taxi driver. Mrs. Phin L. H. hopes to use this loan to dig a well and purchase a water-pump machine to supply water to her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump machine to supply water to her crops.

loans.name: Ashura's Stereo Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 40 years old. She is married and has five children, ages 21, 18, 16, 15, and 11. She owns a cosmetics shop, which she opened in 1983. Her shop is open from 10am to 4pm daily.

Ashura hopes to receive a loan to buy more stock for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in tailoring, beauty salon services, as well as soft drink and food sales.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay T. is a butcher in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He's married and has three children. He owns the butcher shop that serves one of the neighborhoods in Khachmaz. He runs the shop with the help of his wife and children.

Oktay has already successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for additional funding of $1,200 in order to purchase more animals that he will be able to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: To purchase animals for slaughter

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov C. N. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two little children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling various kinds of Khmer foods to the people in her area, making on average of around $3 each day. Her husband works as a tire repairman, making generally about $2 each day. Mrs. Nov C. N. is applying for a loan to enable her to purchase more utensils to expand her business, and with the rest of the loan she would like to reinvest in her growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to expand her business, and to reinvest in her growing business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose O. sells foodstuff and drinks. She is married with three children and she is 50 years old. She is from Edo State. According to her, if given the loan of $450, it will enable her buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She learned the business for 6 months and started hers in 1998.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon I., 42, works wI. her husband on a piece of land growing various kinds of vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumber, chili, radish, and lettuce. WI. this business, the couple can collectively earn around $3 each day from selling their output to market. Additionally, this couple has six children. One of them is employed in a factory; three are construction workers and the rest are married and stay separately. Mrs. Suon I. hopes to use this loan to purchase another piece of farmland to enable her to expand a number of her crops.Her current farmland is quite narrow so it’s so hard to grow more crops to meet her client's demand.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of farmland to expand her crops.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon I., 42, works wI. her husband on a piece of land growing various kinds of vegetables like as tomatoes, cucumber, chili, radish, salads and so on. WI. this business activity, this couple can collectively earns around $3 each day in revenue from selling their outputs to a market. Additionally, this couple has six children. One of them is employed in a factory; three of which are construction workers and the rest of whom are too young to attend school. Mrs. Suon I. hopes to use this loan to purchase a piece of farmland to enable her expand a number of her crops because her current farmland is quite narrow so it’s so hard to grow more crops to meet her client demand.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of farmland to expand her crops.

loans.name: Zal

texts.en:
Zal H. owns and operates a shoe repair shop in the northeasterly town of Khachmaz. He is married and has seven children.

Zal has been working as a cobbler for 15 years. He has already repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for additional funding of $1,200 so that he can purchase items such as: leather, tools, and mainly a new work bench.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and material for his business.

loans.name: Cecilia's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Cecilia is 46 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 14, 12, and 8. She is a food vendor and started her business in 2006. She works from 7am to 10pm daily, selling a variety of dishes and snacks. She makes a monthly profit of about $270 from this business.

Cecilia hopes for a loan to buy more food items in order to expand the services available to her customers. She will share this loan with her subgroup who all have businesses dealing in food and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara owns a cassava mill. She is 50 years old and is married with 6 children. She is a member of LAPO and a native of Bini. She needs the loan amount of $375 to buy an additional grinding machine. This, she said, will help her serve her customers better. She has 11 years experience in this business. She thanks you!

loans.use: To buy a cassava mill machine

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros U., 47, is a farmer growing seasonal rice crops. She typically makes around $2 each day. Her husband works at a carpentry store and generally makes around $5 each day. One of her children is employed by a nearby garment factory and the rest are currently unemployed. Mrs. Ros U. hopes to use this loan to purchase another piece of farmland to grow more of a variety of crops to enable her generate more income for her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of farmland to grow more of a variety of crops

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old. She is married and has a five year old child. She owns a vegetable stand, a business she started in 2005. This stand brings in a monthly profit of about $80 and is open until 8pm daily.

Ruth hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She belongs to the loan group named Tunajali.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her business

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong Y., 24, is married with one small child and her 22-year-old husband. They live in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on a plot of land breeding ducks and growing rice, making collectively about $10 in revenue from selling their ducks, duck eggs, and rice to a market. Mrs. Yong Y. hopes to use this loan to increase her number of ducks to generate more profit for her family.

loans.use: To expand her livestock.

loans.name: Elikram

texts.en:
Elikram B. is an auto mechanic in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is married and has five children.

Elikram B. has been working as a mechanic for the last 15 years. Elikram has successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He has proved to be one of their valued and trusted customers. He is currently looking for additional funding of $1,200 so that he can invest in purchasing more modern tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for his business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia deals in palm oil. She is 53 years old and married with 4 children. She is the leader of her union. She needs the loan amount of $525 to buy more palm oil for sale. She has been in the business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for sale

loans.name: Dim

texts.en: Mrs. Dim N., 43, works on her rice paddy growing crops and different kinds of vegetables, making on average around $6 each day in revenue. Her husband is a fisherman. One of her children works at a garment factory, another one is a student, and the rest are too young to attend school. Mrs. Dim N. will use this loan to purchase a hand-tractor to help plow the farm soil.

loans.use: To purchase a hand-tractor to help plow the farm soil.

loans.name: Mahadia

texts.en:
Mahadia is 26 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 7 months. She has a business selling clothes and shoes, which she began in 2006. She works from 9am to 4pm daily and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from this business.

In the past, Mahadia took a loan to expand her business. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan to continue expanding services for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing inventory

loans.name: Gudret

texts.en:
Gudret G. is married and has two children. He owns and operates a hardware store in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi.

He has been running this store for the last 10 years. He is currently looking for funding of $1,200 so that he can increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Edos

texts.en: Madam Edo is a union leader in LAPO; she is 52 years old and married with four children. She owns a restaurant for the sales of drinks and pepper soup. She is a Bini by tribe. She is asking for the loan amount of $450 to buy more crate sof drinks for sale. She started the business in 1991.

loans.use: To buy crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen I. is into sales of foodstuffs and provisions. She is 32 years old and married with four children. She has been in the business since 2001. She is from Edo State and a member of LAPO. She needs the loan of $450 to buy a grinding machine for grinding peppers, corn and beans.

loans.use: To buy a grinding machine

loans.name: Husna's Kinondoni Group

texts.en:
Husna is 38 years old. She is a widow who takes care of her two children who are 12 and 9. She has a fruit stand, where she sells fruit from 6:30am to 6:30pm daily. This business was started in 1997 and now brings her a monthly profit of about $280.

Husna hopes for a loan to increase the amount of food she can purchase. She will share this loan with Petronila, who has a beauty salon business.

loans.use: To buy fruit stock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a salon stylist; she does hair in different styles for people in her community. She is married with four children. She is 38 years old. She needs the loan of $450 to enable her buy weavon (hair-weaving product) and other hair accessories and drinks to sell. She learned the business for 2 years and started this one in 1995.

loans.use: To buy more hair accessories and drinks

loans.name: Hesenaga

texts.en:
Hesenaga K. owns and operates two stores in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi.

He operates both, a home electronics store and a store that sells carpets. Hesenaga has successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for additional funding of $1,200 so that he can increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rukia's Kinondoni Group

texts.en:
Rukia is 30 years old. She is married with three children, ages 14, 10 and 1. She has a business selling clothing, which she started in 2006. She works daily from 7am to 6pm and makes a monthly profit of about $90 from this business.

Rukia hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will share this loan with Salama, who also sells clothing in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Thi Nhung

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nhung, 41 years old, is a widow with three children. Although she has to raise her children by herself, she is happy because all her kids are well behaved and make good grade at school. She makes and sells bánh chưng, a kind of glutinous rice cake that Vietnamese can’t live without in Tết celebration. She also caters her products to weddings. She would like to apply for a loan from Binh Minh to buy rice. It is easy to pay back in small installments. Her daily income is about 4USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Nhung, 41 tuổi, đã có chồng và 3 con, tuy nhiên chồng cô mất sớm một mình cô phải nuôi các cháu ăn học. Rất vui vì các con cô đều ngoan và học giỏi. Cô làm bánh trưng bán, một thứ bánh không thể thiếu trong ngày Tết cổ truyền, bánh của cô làm ra đến đâu bán hết đến đó. Ngoài ra cô còn nhận làm bánh phục vụ cho các đám cưới, cô vay vốn về mua thêm gạo để dự trữ làm dần. Thu nhập mỗi ngày của cô cũng được từ 50-60 nghìn đồng. Cô sẽ tiết kiệm để trả dần theo chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh.

loans.use: Mua gạo

loans.name: Seyidsusen

texts.en:
Seyidsusen P. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a miscellaneous item store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi.

The store sells household items as well as some clothing items. Seyidsusen and her husband are currently looking for a loan of $950 so that they can expand and diversify their inventory.

loans.use: To expand and diversify their inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en:
Melahet K. owns and operates a store at the market in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Melahet.

She has successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently applying for a loan of $1,200 so she can further expand and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Thi Hien

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hiền, 32 years old, is married with two children. She’s been serving breakfasts at her food stand for ten years since before she married to her husband. She has never borrowed money from any bank because banks just offer big loans. She would like to apply for a small loan at Binh Minh that she will pay back in small installments. She needs money to replace old tables in the dining room.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hiền, 32 tuổi, đã có chồng và 2 con. Chị làm nghề bán hàng ăn sáng, bán cháo, phở... và bánh mỳ. Chị bán hàng đã được 10 năm nay từ khi còn là con gái. Mặc dù là bán hàng ăn sáng nhưng chị thường phải chuẩn bị từ rất sớm. Chị chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đâu vì các Ngân hàng chỉ cho vay với số lượng lớn, chị thích vay theo chương trình Tài chính vi mô bình minh cdc vì được trả dần. Chị vay để mua thêm một số bàn ăn mới vì nó đã quá cũ rồi.

loans.use: Replace dining tables in food stand

loans.name: Thi Nguyet

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyệt, 38 years old, has 3 school age children. She and her husband have a bicycle business. They’ve been in this business long time ago. They sell a lot of bikes at the start of school season. The shop carries brand new bikes but her husband sometimes puts used parts together for those who can not afford a new one. They have all kinds of bikes to satisfy everyone’s need. She would like to borrow money to replenish their shop. Daily income allows to pay small installments easily.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyệt, 38 tuổi, có 3 con còn đang đi học. Cả hai vợ chồng chị kinh doanh xe đạp từ lâu. Chị bán đắt hàng nhất khi học sinh bắt đầu đi học. Chị thường mua xe về bán, đôi khi chồng chị cũng lắp ráp lại từ những chiếc xe cũ để bán cho những người có thu nhập ít hơn, hay sử dụng vào mục đích khác. Xe chị bán có nhiều loại phù hợp với từng người. Chị vay vốn về để mua thêm xe bán.Ngày nào chị cũng có người mua nên có thu nhập, việc trả vốn hàng tuần không là vấn đề lớn đối với chị.

loans.use: Expand bicycle business

loans.name: Ramla's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Ramla is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 children, ages 10, 7, and 4. She has a business, selling clothes, which she started 2 years ago. Now, she works from 9am to 3pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $90 from this business.

Ramla hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will share this loan with her loan subgroup, who have businesses in cosmetics, food, and clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Minh, 33 years old, and her husband have 2 children. She sells mobile phones, eye glasses and watches. She’s been in this business for 10 years now. She was referred to the Binh Minh by a friend. She likes it because its procedures are simple, its people are friendly. Her activities with the fund is not just taking out loans, she has a saving account too. She needs a loan to buy more goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Minh, 33 tuổi, có 2 con. Hai vợ chồng chị kinh doanh điện thoại di dộng và kính, đồng hồ các loại. Chị kinh doanh đã được trên 10 năm. Vốn đầu tư cho cửa hàng khá lớn nên chị cũng vay vốn của hội doanh nghiệp trẻ và chị cũng là thành viên của hội. Chị tham gia vay nguồn vốn của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh do được người bạn giới thiệu. Chị thích vay của chương trình vì thủ tục đơn giản, lại được hướng dẫn tư vấn tận tình của các cán bộ tín dụng. Chị vay về đầu tư mua thêm một số kiểu kính mới. Chị không những vay vốn mà còn gửi tiết kiệm mặc dù không lớn nhưng chị có thể sử dụng khi cần.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Salma's Kitokiondo Group

texts.en:
Salma is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 5 and 3. She and her husband also take care of four other children. Salma owns a beauty parlor which she opened six years ago. The parlor provides services for both men and women and is open from 8am to 8pm daily. In a month, the parlor brings Salma a profit of about $180.

In the past, Salma successfully took out a loan to increase the products available in her parlor. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her loan subgroup.

loans.use: to expand her parlor's services

loans.name: Mize

texts.en:
Mize is 31 years old. She is married and has four children, ages 14, 11, 7 and 3. She owns a business making and selling snacks in Dar es Salaam. She started this business 6 years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $80. She works from 7am to 11am daily.

Mize has successfully taken a previous loan to increase her sales. Currently, she would like a new loan for the same purpose. She belongs to a loan group called Ngarambe.

loans.use: to buy food stock to make snacks

loans.name: Farida's Kitomondo C Group

texts.en:
Farida is married and has three children, ages 17, 13, and 7. She runs a business selling clothes, which she started a year and a half ago. She works from 7am to 8:30pm daily selling clothes.

In the past, Farida took out a loan to increase her inventory. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Farida, who sells rice.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Kabowa 2(B) Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old and married with four children. She runs a small retail shop where she sells various items to the residents of her village. She plans to use the extra income made possible by this loan to buy a refrigerator and pay her rent. Sarah, Julliet and Rose all sell raw foodstuffs in the market, and like Agnes, want to acquire new items to sell. They will pay pay school fees for their children with the extra money they make from selling these items.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying new items to sell.

loans.name: Kabowa 2(C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for nine months. Rose is 35 years old and married with three children.She runs a retail shop and needs new inventory to sell to her customers. Rose will use the money she earns from selling this inventory to start a new business raising poultry. Juliet and Sarah sell clothes. Jolic offers laundry services and wants to increase her income so she can buy a generator.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Kabowa 2(C) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for nine months. Rose is 35 years old and married with 3 children.She runs a retail shop. She intends to start a poultry business with the extra profits. Juliet and Sarah both sell clothes. Jolic offers laundry sevices and wants to buy a generator with the extra profits.

loans.use: To add in stock in the shop.

loans.name: Martha's Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Martha is 27 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 4 and 6. She owns a business selling fruit, which she started in 2004. She sells fruit from 8am to 10pm daily and currently makes a monthly profit of about $280 from this business.

Martha hopes for a loan to buy more stocks of fruit. She will share this loan with her loan subgroup, who have businesses selling general items, clothing, and food.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Salma's Peace Group

texts.en:
Salma is 38 years old. She is married and has 3 children, ages 16, 11, and 1. She owns a small cafe where she serves breakfast, lunch, and snacks from 6am to 3pm everyday. From this business, which she started in 2006, she makes a monthly profit of about $110.

Salma hopes for a loan to increase the quantity of food she can serve at her cafe. She will share this loan with Sada and Zaina, members in her subgroup called Peace.

loans.use: to buy food items for her cafe

loans.name: Kabowa 2(D) Group

texts.en:
The group of four women has been together for one year. Nulu is 44 years old and married with seven children. She has a poultry farm, and will use her portion of the loan to buy baby chicks to raise. When they are grown, she will sell them and use the money to buy a piece of land. Christine sells charcoal, Allen is a poultry farmer and Zaina runs a retail shop. They all need new inventory to sell to their customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and other items to sell

loans.name: Salma's Jikwamue 1 Group

texts.en:
Salma is 48 years old. She is married and has a grown child. She and her husband take care of three of their relative's children, who are ages 13, 14, and 16. Salma owns a business selling fish, eggs, and clothing. She started in this trade in 2005 and now makes a profit of about $110 per month from her sales. She works daily from 10am to 5pm.

Salma and her subgroup hope for a loan to improve their businesses. Salma's fellow subgroup members have businesses selling food and door locks.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Kabowa 2 (E) Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 32 years old and runs a small poultry farm. When time permits, she also works in a beauty salon. Aisha will use her portion of the loan to buy chickenfeed and more chicks to raise. She will use the income they produce to bring electricity to her home and build a new poultry house. Amina, Esther and Carol all sell produce in the local market, and will use their portion of the loan to buy more items to sell to their customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more chicks, chickenfeed and produce

loans.name: Kabowa 3 (A) Group

texts.en: Rose is 34-year-old widow with four children. She owns and works in a  beauty salon, and she and her co-applicants have applied for a loan to buy additional supplies and equipment for this business. Rose intends to use the income made possible by the loan to pay school fees for her children and start a new business raising poultry.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for a beauty parlor.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kabowa 3 (B) Group

texts.en:
Gloria M. is married and has five children. She helps support her family by working as a seamstress, and plans to use the income generated by the two new sewing machines she hopes to buy to pay her rent and her children's school fees. Flavia sells hardware, Jesca has a retail shop and Vincencia runs a kiosk. All three women will use this loan to add to the inventory of items they have to sell to their customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and other items

loans.name: Ashura's Hekima Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 28 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 3 and 8. She owns a tailoring business, where she works from 8am to 5pm daily. She started this business in 1998 and now makes a monthly profit of about $235 from her work.

Ashura hopes for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food and clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nuru's Amani Group

texts.en:
